Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States

gy4FuXmrmwwmikmHnr2YKw.text: We at at Lon's for our anniversary celebration a few weeks ago.  I'd made the reservation online at OpenTable.  The staff welcomed us with a happy anniversary greeting right when we walked in and remembered our anniversary during dinner as well. Nice touches for sure.  Some reviews has said the staff ignored their special events here, but we didn't find that to be the case at all.  The food was very good. Not great.  Not for the prices paid.  But a stroll around the hotel gardens after dinner was quite nice. I'd like to back when the weather is cooler and eat outside on the patio - that looked very pretty.

YP-I_ZPDZi94rYx6Nymsyw.text: Had dinner here last night for my husbands 60th birthday .The service and food were impeccable, and the wine cellar amazing. I would very highly recommend going here. Thank You so much for making the night special. We will never forget it. The Lucas's

KX_3LkLIjleAzr5suLCqsQ.text: We were in town staying @ the Biltmore. The reviews were enticing.  Yes, beautiful ambiance and a great place for a romantic dinner.  Our server was outstanding.  Very knowledgeable and easy going (Midwesterner of course).  The tuna appetizer was fantastic!  Probably the best we've ever had.   Unfortunately the steak was a disappointed for the price we paid.  We love rib-eye, so when we saw it on the menu we knew what we would order. The aroma was amazing but the steak itself, chewy and over charred. Come on!!!  For sides Amy had the mac & cheese.  Salty and OK but not great.  The broccoli, OK but not great!  Same with the mashed potatoes.  It was a beautiful restaurant by left disappointed.

QzAF7jFxtivKINfTOQajEA.text: Always wanted to try this place out after hearing it featured on KYOT Sunday Brunch. Can't recall how I managed a day off, but I finally found my way to see KYOT's set up at Lon's. I did make an online reservation through opentable.com and even added a note that I would like to be seated outside near the KYOT set-up. Arrived, mentioned my reservations, and was immediately seated INSIDE. Waited at least ten minutes before I was given a glass of iced water. Another 5 minutes passed by before my server introduced herself to me. I asked if I may be seated outside since this was my main reason for dropping by- to be able to enjoy my meal outdoors, with KYOT's smooth sounds surrounding me. I was soon placated. Vacillated between blueberry buckwheat pancakes and Lon's burger entree. Asked for server's recommendation and was told to go for the pancakes. Had a few of Lon's delicious signature pastries. Especially favored the raspberry pastry and the chocolate croissants!! In the meantime, other patrons were being handed delicious-looking entrees. Made me wish I'd ordered the burger. I did enjoy the buckwheat pancakes, although I wished there were more of the blueberry compote. Kind of pricey for me, though. Definitely paying for the atmosphere. I would make sure to eat outdoors to take advantage of the lovely setting,

aH2VGLCDwsY5Gsoy6LqhsA.text: My wife and I went there ate there on a Monday after Easter and very much enjoyed the atmosphere and had a good waiter, Hoke and a knowledgeable sommelier.  The place has a great outdoor area and a nice wine list.  We ordered 3 pigs as an appetizer and it was mediocre at best.  The pork loin had very little taste but a good sauce, the pork belly was fatty and the cheeks were good.  Both the manager and the waiter asked  about the dish and when we truthfully told them that it was average and disappointing there was no response.  I think they said that they would tell the chef! I wasn't looking for a comp, but if you are going to ask the question and listen to the response, you should make some sort of effort to rectify. (Replace the dish, comp the meal, or buy a dessert)   On a $250 dinner, it's the least that you can do.  We split the chicken and the duck and it was a nice presentation and they split the plates in the kitchen which was a nice touch.  Chicken was good but not exceptional as we were led to believe.  Duck was very good and was definitely the highlight of the night.  I doubt I would return. It wasn't a bad meal, it was just okay food with a great bottle of wine, good service  and great ambiance and not inexpensive.  Sanctuary the night before was far superior at a similar price point.

7OZuvmg7aQvG8gJrYuraUA.text: Looked forward to eating here for so long...too bad it was on my birthday - food was good but the service was deplorable so not going to rehash this too much (apologies to my man and bro as I know they were also hoping for better)  The appetizers were by far the best thing - the entree's were good with red meat being the star.  Peach cobbler desert was all topping that I swear was merely microwaved and had one slice of grilled peach - putting a candle on it did nothing to make me think this was the birthday dessert I was for...   I highly recommend the flight of 10, 20 30 & 40 yr old ports - this mellowed out the complete waste of skin that was our server. Not sure if he thought we looked unable to tip for a spendy bill or weren't as enthralled as the table next to us with his Montana stories but my brother aptly reconfirmed his tip expectation with 7% - too much in my opinion for not giving diddley about someone chosing their restaurant to celebrate in.

NuNZ7-3TQc1NTY4fSDAAPA.text: Such an amazing experience at Lon's. I brought someone who is special to me here for their birthday in hopes of it being a special night. Lon's did not disappoint. We sat on the patio and the ambiance, service, and food was extravagant. It was the best dining experience we have had. If you want to treat someone you love to something special, you will not be disappointed bringing them here.

My8M136KJIPGur_bE6-_cQ.text: My dad was in town from Florida during the week. I met him for breakfast at the Hermosa. I had my taste buds set on ordering the breakfast blt on the pretzel bun, only to find out it was no longer on the menu. I left slightly disappointed. Breakfast was mediocre

kN08Mh-Gfx15k9PAkDpJEA.text: Lon's is still a great place for brunch, esp. on the outdoor patio.  It's a beautiful spot, the service is great, and food is (mostly) good.  The monkey bread did not disappoint.  It's gotten fancier over the years, but still delicious.    The egg benedict was disappointing.  The hollandaise sauce just wasn't right.  Not sure what was missing. And the avocado that replaced the Canadian bacon in it (a modification) did not taste fresh, more like out of a package.  Prices are pretty average for a restaurant at a luxury hotel.    Nearby self parking is available.  Will return.

eItqdqp65REqSIRe0RV8CA.text: Weekend brunch at Lon's is such a delight. We ordered the cava and I had the crab egg's Benedict with spinach. The serving size was perfect for me, although on the light side. I was happy to give up the muffin for a crab cake that was exquisite. The outside seating area is beautiful w large, white umbrellas and plenty of shaded seating. I would recommend a reservation if you plan to come around noon, especially on Sunday, as it fills up fast. The only negative was that service was a little slow at the start and our waiter was not the most gregarious fellow. The young coffee server, however, was sweet and attentive.

2Bao9n_qS8WYrkeoYNIt6Q.text: Beautiful patio!! Great service !!  Delicious food! Went it for anniversary weekend brunch!  Perfect patio weather!  Food was great! And our server Gabby and the others were great!  We started with the monkey bread. (Amazing!) I had the traditional eggs Benedict   And my husband had the huevos rancheros  And we shared an oatmeal (it was excellent) .  Our server Gabby surprised us with anniversary dessert (complementary)   Definitely recommend Lon's Last drop brunch I enjoyed the beautiful patio ...  can't  wait to try other menu items and dinner!

Twp_AQSCb6QFxfW8z98siQ.text: I went with 2 friends. What a beautiful hotel the grounds and flowers are gorgeous. Our waiter was Brandon and he was wonderful. We had the Sizzling Bacon for an appetizer (OMG) fantastic. We also had the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes, the Short rib hash and the Traditional eggs benedict. For drinks we had White Sangria, the horseradish/yellow bloody mary and the chipotle/tomato bloody mary. This is my new favorite place. They have a lovely patio. I will be going back for dinner. You will really enjoy this place.

jLgj5AvrT1FV2Drzyipe1w.text: Back in town on business and decided to give this hidden gem another try and this time, it didn't disappoint. I made reservations for 9 at 7p well in advance but at the last minute, 2 hours before, I asked if we could arrive an hour earlier and even though they were completely booked, they accommodated. We then arrived 15 minutes earlier than that and were sat straight away.  There are no words to explain the magical ambiance of this establishment. The kivas, strings of lights, beautiful grounds, live acoustic music from the 80/90s that is beautifully slowed down and played in the background (tom petty, van morrison, sting, george strait), the well planned, well prepared and delicious food, and (this time) the attentive wait staff (A+ for Rodrigo) made this night one to remember.  My sincerest thanks to the manager, Bill Parker. It's clear my first dining experience was a one off. This is definitely a place to dine at again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Braised beef shortribs (again). Still perfection.

Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Kabocha Squash Soup: intriguing ingredients (toasted cinnamon marshmallow/candied bacon). Solid, sweet and citrusy all at the same time.
Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. S&#39;mores Bombe. I mean, it&#39;s chocolate mouse, chocolate cake  and marshmallows. What can go wrong?!

Rse_peSkawvVzYrKiNaIrQ.text: Delicious Anniversary dinner at Lon's, with excellent service as usual! Stephen the somme was amazing, picked the perfect wine for our meal. Our waiter was Brandon, and he was careful and kind in working with the kitchen to keep our meal vegan. All around 5 stars!

5oOUzTJQ7sM4HouQqAm4Ag.text: I brought my boyfriend here for our Anniversary, and had high expectations based on the reviews. It was OK, but nothing special which was disappointing beyond words. I am vegetarian and they had no vegetarian options on the menu besides a side of Brussels Sprouts and a side of Mashed Potatoes, which is exactly what I ordered. Normally you can't go wrong with either, but the Brussels Sprouts were under cooked with no flavor- I paid $200 for a meal in which I ate a side of mashed potatoes.   The service was good, and our waiter was good. My boyfriend said his fish was good but not great. The only reason we gave 2 stars rather than 1 was because the service was good, the wine was good, and that's about it.

jo4DFWIb8So8v_vbmAJ3GA.text: The staff at Lon's really went over and above in providing a wonderful night in celebration my fiance's birthday.  They greeted him with Birthday wishes and a card signed by all the staff and sat us at a secluded romantic table.  The service and food was impeccable!  We'll definitely be back!

OjOoL-FEgRSmj-vMk1gStw.text: This place has THE BEST food. Their menu is Southwestern inspired and has some minor changes seasonally. Their cuts of beef are AMAZING! Their dining experience is second to none. All the people are very accommodating and extremely helpful. The patio is a perfect setting for a nice, quiet (and romantic) dinner and their sitting area by the fireside is a perfect place to end your evening with an after dinner drink.   HIGHLY recommend this place for a nicer evening out.

ECVT2sBSPPJfroa9YRgQMw.text: We were so excited to celebrate Thanksgiving at Lon's Hermosa Inn.  The food was not good at all. So disappointing.  My husband ordered Turkey and the first plate was dry and pressed turkey roll!  OMG $75 a plate and he got a pressed turkey roll .  I am a vegetarian and had called ahead 3 times and asked what was the meal accommodations for a vegetarian.  No one ever called me back. As a result I didn't eat ... what a big disappointed holiday dinner.  The service was so slow.  They need improvement for sure!'

Utsv3ZveqZsqK_WnJHxfVw.text: Time for an update: I've concluded that Lon's is one of my top restaurants in the valley!! I absolutely love the ambiance, the service, the food, everything except the price. Haha but definitely worth it!!   I had to bring my hubby here because he's never been even though I've dined here twice. We decided to make reservations for date night around 5:30p. It was the perfect weather at the perfect restaurant. We had to wait a few minutes to be seated because we were early so we sat at the patio and I ordered a painkiller while hubby ordered a beer. The painkiller was refreshing and we were finally seated outdoors. Live music started playing and it was so romantic, I felt like I was in a movie.  We ordered the calamari, the pork special (split), and the truffle Mac and cheese. Oh my - everything was decadent! The calamari had the perfect seasoning, the pork special had so much flavor and ingredients that went well together, and the Mac and cheese was cooked perfectly (not too hard and not too soft). We were so full that we skipped dessert.  Check came to $87 - if you split a plate, they will charge you $5. Service was great and it was a great date night!!

JdyKciIchDR2FZXSshAMjw.text: What a place. Fantastic, important and memorable. Not only was the food delicious and grand, but the entire staff made us feel so special. We were celebrating a big birthday and the staff hand signed the birthday card.. a class act. We had Vincent serving us and he was a perfect host, kindly recommending with care and confidence. Everyone at Lons, from the front of the restaurant to the back were friendly and made us feel welcome with a confident smile and hello. Somehow too doing it all without it feeling overdone or too fussy. This is exactly how you do service. Great job everyone. Thank you for a very memorable evening.

S59HHQejdTFZ-NRIa0edNQ.text: Wonderful traditional Arizona resort setting.  Delicious selection of appetizers,  entrees, desserts and drinks. Attentive ave friendly waitstaff. Great patio for enjoying sunset dinner.

0pDcdICrP-fNZ5eeAEUWaw.text: Sort of thought that I had written a review previously but I guess not.  Lon's is one of my favorite places in the Paradise Valley area.  It has an amazing location, with old trees, beautiful cactus and flowers everywhere. The patio is perfect, but in many ways the inside is just as nice, like dining in a classy old home.  They do a nice, seasonal tasting menu for $75 that includes a raw course, starter, entree and dessert.  This is an amazing deal that you can choose without the whole table participating. Think oysters, pork belly, and duck. The beauty is that you can also order any of these options a la carte. Last night we had the 16oz Tomahawk Duroc Pork Chop that was perfectly done with a nice mole and apple chutney. The Chicken is simple and perfect with perfectly cheesy mashed potatoes and grilled Broccolini.  The Salmon was perfectly cooked to just opaque in the middle with seared skin, barley, and chunks of chorizo.  The filet was crusted with pecans and served over a dense potato cake with Nueske bacon and and a reduced red wine sauce.  Nicely creamed greens finished this dish. A side of sweet and bacons Brussels Sprouts was perfect.  Expect nice cocktails, a great wine list, and unique desserts, although this time we didn't try those.  The service is very polished, but this time was a bit lacking.  Go here and enjoy.  We will be back again and

Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Salmon with barley and chorizo.

tIocu2vqy7usmAtmM6mNRw.text: Great restaurant to have brunch at. The service is also really good. We had the smoked salmon, the lobster tempura, and the ceviche. The yellow bloody Mary's are awesome. Only comment was smoked salmon didn't seam very smoked to me it seemed like salmon belly to me like what you would get at a sushi place.

Uv_peNpvEoyyxhURPjRh5w.text: Loved the grounds and quality of food. Servers are professional but don't take themselves too seriously. We thoroughly enjoyed the birthday lunch and will go again.

v3MabHsPMTwPv-4ie_R5BQ.text: Lon's has a really beautiful dining room, great food, and wonderful service. I loved the ahi tuna appetizer, shishito peppers, and sweet corn agnolotti.   I was blown away by the quality of the service. We were celebrating a birthday, which we told them about when we made the reservation. After we settled into our table, the hostess brought over a birthday card addressed to the honoree and that was signed by the staff! They also brought a special dessert for him. The waiter and our busser were both so knowledgeable about the menu, and were very attentive and helpful.   The dining room is relatively small and really lovely. But note- this is a really classy place, and you may feel uncomfortable if underdressed.

9IkkrPQfI4QwqLfHwonNDQ.text: Excellent atmosphere dwarfed only by the food & service. I always look forward to the opportunity to dine at Lon's when I'm in Phoenix.

Vf7hgONGrvOA3u0tKRCxcA.text: Breakfast or brunch at lon's is consistently delicious. Good service. Great ambience. Solid menu. Priced right for food and experience.  Go when you have time to relax and take in the experience.

upQWBee9vvFPVFgw4-UMig.text: Absolutely fantastic valentine's day brunch.  I loved it!  But yes, I think the overwhelming beauty of the outdoor patio sitting next to the garden was the highlight, as well as the coffee.  Very scrumptious, full-bodied coffee that our lovely server was kind enough to provide us some beans (for home) and the name of it (yes, of course, I have ordered a bag already).  My husband was crazy about the monkey bread, he is from the South, and the soupiness and sheer sweetness made him squeal with delight.  I hope he doesn't read this, LOL.  I don't mean to overlook what I ate, it was delicious as well, particularly the rustic bread it was served on.  I think with Lon's you need to expect to spend some time there....they can get really busy and elegance just takes time.  Which Lon's has lots of....I will certainly be hoping to go again for brunch before the weather takes a turn for the 100's...

Nu28OTDfx3Icb9LxrL2zvg.text: Went to Lon's this past week to celebrate my friend's 94th birthday.  The reservation was made and also stated about the birthday.  We were seated by the Manager who pulled out my birthday friend's chair and also failed to push it in.  He never mentioned the birthday.  Our waitress Frenchie, was not extremely pleasant, as if a 60-65 year old still had menopause!  We ordered and asked for veggie substitutions which she claimed they do not substitute for ANYTHING!  The service was extremely slow, especially waiting for drinks from the bar.  Frenchie claimed that the bartender was slow,  Her attitude got in the way of celebrating a special event.  She did manage to put a candle in the birthday girl's dessert but never offered a "Happy Birthday."  She charged twice for refills to soda.  The quality of the food was less than mediocre for high prices.  On the way out, I mentioned our experience to the manager Martk Kieru.  He took notes, including my phone number, but never called or followed through with me.    The entire experience was NOT a good one.  I would NOT recomment Lon's to anyone.  As a matter of fact, I would recommend that people stay clear of Lon's and their poor service and mediocre quality of food.

_D77Cv5gUVSb6UsKfIHMuQ.text: Lon's was a complete bust.  Mom took me for a "nice" Christmas dinner.  We succeeded on atmosphere, but that was about it.  While the service was just okay, the food was just terrible.  Keep in mind this was a Christmas Day prix fixe menu at $68/pp, which by Phoenix standards should be the best meal I've had all year.  Appetizers - some sort of sushi thing that was drowned in seaweed, tasted okay but was barely noticeable on the plate.  Also a lobster cake which was okay, came out cold, and wasn't nearly as good as the worst crab cake I've ever had.  Entrees - prime rib came out cold, and I've had better at a cheap buffet carving station.  Veal scallopini was chewy (kind of like a microwaved sponge), and had the most tasteless mozzarella cheese I've ever had.  When we brought this to the attention of the waitress, she asked that they remake all of our food.  About a half hour later we got a better (still not good) version of the veal, and opted to try the ravioli instead of the prime rib they had run out of.  At least the veal came out hot this time.  The ravioli wasn't bad, but probably had more oil than any other ingredient.  I felt greasy after eating it, which was a shame.  Neither of our meals seemed to have any inspiration or fresh ingredients whatsoever.  Desserts - what a sin.  I wonder if this place pays a pastry chef?  I'm spoiled by my step mom's bread pudding, so I understand when others don't step up to the plate, but the bread pudding here is something I would never waste a calorie on again.  And my "apple pie" was simply a joke.  It was clearly canned filling that they didn't even bother to heat, stuffed inside a dry pie shell that tasted like a mouth full of flour.  Ugh!  Our waitress sent the manager over, and he initially came off as unapologetic and insulted that we were unhappy.  He had to go to the table right next to us a few minutes later.  After we waited 20 minutes for our check, he came back again in a slightly better mood.  He explained that the kitchen was tired after being there since the morning and had lost their creativity.  OK I get it, I was tired too, but what kind of creativity do you need to heat up an unimaginative, standard menu?  The night ended with our two glasses of wine and one of our two meals comped.  It was the right thing to do, although I still don't feel like we received nearly a $70 meal.  With so many other locally-focused and inspired restaurants all over the valley, I would certainly recommend against dinner at Lon's.  If I were to go back, it would only be for a glass of wine out on the patio (although I can list a few places I'd rather go for that, too).

KH-8_7zBNyQZqjE477HaNA.text: Beautiful setting but food was nothing special and the hostesses and servers, with the exception of the woman who took our drinks order while we waited, were quite arrogant and unfriendly.  I walked up to the station to check in, and had to wait until the two women behind it finished their conversation before anyone looked at me which I found extremely rude for a place like this. Maybe everyone was having a bad day, but it is unlikely I will choose to go back.

6FP-vkVU7kyqpaEuCnO4eA.text: Such a beautiful property!  The ambiance was lovely and food was delicious...but be prepared to spend some money!

rMKnjrjmz9wNP5YsESOMog.text: Restaurant Week makes writing reviews complicated. Restaurants lower their prices during this 7-day period (a three-course meal runs you $29 per person) in order to gain new customers and fill spots during less-popular dining times. At places like Lon's or Cowboy Ciao, guests end up getting meals that would normally cost $50 or more per person for a mere $29. Knowing that I got a much-more expensive meal at a bit of a discount definitely makes me want to give Lon's a higher rating. At the same time, however, my husband and I were discussing that we would have been disappointed with our experience *had we paid* twice the price. And since people reading this review may not have the good fortune of going to Lon's during the RW, when prices are lower than normal, I'm going to have to give the restaurant 3 stars. This is based on the food not being that flavorful or impressive given the prices they normally charge. We started the meal with Absolut martinis, which were pricey at $12 each and contained vermouth even though we asked for them "dry." Since we, just like Joel L, thought that spare ribs was a strange starter but both wanted to try them, we decided to pick a starter off the regular menu. We both love duck, so we ordered the salad with the seared duck. It wasn't great. We liked that it had pine nuts but found the dressing to be overwhelming acidic and were disappointed by the four pepperoni-shaped, paper-thin, and bland-tasting duck pieces. The disappointment continued with the spare ribs. I loved the sweet potato puree that accompanied them but found the ribs themselves to be a bit dry and not all that flavorful. The "carrot jus" was not detectable (or if it was, didn't add much), and we were dismayed to see that the listing for the same ribs on the regular menu said that the meat came with "ancho chile chocolate sauce." How sad that the RW version of the ribs didn't have the opportunity to be dressed up in a more flavorful sauce! For my entree, I ordered the pan-roasted scallops with the roasted pepper spaetzle, organic spinach, and the corn jus. My husband doesn't care for scallops much, but I found them to be well-cooked and not too metallic or gritty (as bad scallops can be). The sides, especially the spaetzle, were interesting and pretty flavorful. I could definitely taste that the spinach was organic. I also had a glass of wine with my entree and did appreciate the pairings listed on the RW menu next to each course, which made it easy to quickly choose an appropriate wine. My husband had the open-faced shrimp ravioli. We both loved the concept and again, found the vegetables to be really fresh and tender. However, we didn't taste anything resembling lobster jus and found the shrimp to be pretty over-cooked. The portion was small, which we usually don't mind if the dish is high-end and super-flavorful, but that wasn't really the case here. In terms of desserts, the lemon tarte was just ok (and actually reminded me of those lemon bars you make from a boxed mix), but the chocolate truffle torte with the minted berries was outstanding. Since we weren't blown away by any of the other dishes we had tried, it was really nice to end the meal with a delicious, rich dessert. I am glad to have had a romantic meal in a beautiful patio setting for only $29 per person, but again, we would have been quite disappointed with Lon's food had we gone and paid regular prices for everything ($25+ for the shrimp ravioli would have been the most disappointing). That being said, I can't reiterate how peaceful and unique the patio setting is, and the service was certainly professional and attentive (the bus boys did an especially nice job of keeping the table clean and re-filling water glasses). The atmosphere and service may make me want to go back at some point (maybe on someone else's dime!) and give Lon's food another try. One final note - Lon's does take reservations through OpenTable.com although the email confirmation requested that we call the restaurant directly in order to secure patio seating, so I would suggest making direct contact with the restaurant if it really matters to you to sit on the patio.

5ARPBw6QvNJdGrPqbocJOg.text: This was our 2nd time at Lon's. The 1st time was perfection, hence the return visit. Lunch on a patio doesn't get any better, period! Gorgeous view of Camelback Mountain and a patio I'd like to have in my backyard. We started off w/some foie gras and seared shrimp appetizers and both were terrific. We then split a grilled chicken sandwich. Yummy! The staff is fun and friendly. I love an interactive and thoughtful waiter staff!! I noted in the reservation it was our anniversary and they had a nice surprise for us at the end of our meal. The only thing I can complain about is my own fault and that's having not gone there at sunset as it's supposed to be s great place for that. We'll get there though, otherwise, kudos! Kudos and kudos!!!

FMnI03TH6eJ1S_UN5XniKg.text: We shared the seared ahi tuna app which was delicious. Then diver scallops and the salmon. While quite good it took a long time for the entrees to come and there was no consideration given for that. Comping our sorbet would have made this a 5 star review.

Cz_Y-A92y-VRL5ObEqcuJQ.text: My fiancee and I visited Lon's at the Hermosa on a Friday night in June to celebrate our anniversary and was a perfect location for a little romance under the calm, star-cloaked Arizona sky in a pocket of wilderness within the sprawling Phoenix metro.   Lon's provided one of the most inspired meals I've had in quite a while, beginning expeditiously with a world-class wine list, representative of various renowned grape-squeezing regions as the Pacific Coast, Italy, France, Argentina, Chile, Spain, Portugal, Australia and New Zealand.  After a quick consult with a very capable sommelier who spirited us with an impressive explanation of Portuguese reds, we agreed on a bottle on Golfo [?], which may or may not be the correct name, as it smartly inoculated us after two and a half glasses each.  Mmm!  In place of a starter, we ordered two unique salads: Mine was a seared duck salad on baby greens with toasted pine nuts an a white vinaigrette.  It was ingenious ... but not quite as ingenious as the scallop salad my fiancee had.  They were absolutely the best-prepared scallops either of us had ever experienced.  What is even more amazing is that the salads were surpassed in flavor by the entrees, which sometimes flops as a headliner to gourmet starters.  Not the case here.  My sun dried tomato crusted rack of lamb was prepared excellently and the crust paired with the tender, juicy lamb chops (4) was easily skyrocketed into the top 3 list of things I've ever tasted.  The goat cheese herb grits were a perfect, and light compliment .. and something I've truly never seen on a menu before, much less experienced by taste.    My fiancee's grilled filet of salmon with blackberry barbeque glaze was very much an original as well.  Even for someone who is not a gigantic fan of salmon, such as myself, really enjoyed the complexity of flavors.  She very much enjoyed it.  For dessert, we had the sorbet sampler as a means of cooling off from our frenetic eating/drinking pace.  Although very delicious, it was a mistake on my part as there was a sampler of tiramasu/creme brulee/pote de chocolate.  Ugh.  What was I thinking bypassing this delicious plate of hyperglycemia?  Well, there's always next time.  It also must be noted, the stellar service we received.  The server was absolutely charming, gracious, and accommodative, referring to us by name, refilling our water/wine glasses, and supervising small touches like fetching the sommelier and informing the pastry chef that it was our anniversary [with that information, they gave us a chocolate script 'Happy Anniversary' on our dessert plate - nice touch].  Overall, it was a place worthy of a very special occasion, and one which I would not hesitate to return to so that we can experience the rest of their impressive menu.

h-RxS7smxQImGFAGEgNHFg.text: It was my first time here and I loved this restaurant. Beautiful grounds and we had a wonderful meal at sunset.   The food was very good, with the truffle mac & cheese being a fave. The wine list is extensive with lots of unique choices. The staff was attentive and made good suggestions.   Bonus: One person in our crew needed gluten free options and the kitchen gave her a ton of choices. So folks with food allergies, you can really eat here too!

DeHas3QQO6921I5xI5DO6w.text: Our first visit to this place most of our friends love was disappointing.  The setting and service were excellent, but the food was not.  The selection was limited: 4 starters and five entrees.  A halibut entree was overcooked (read:dry) and bland.  The side dish of mustard coated Brussels sprouts was undercooked-- very hard and almost impossible to poke with a fork: also rather flavorless.  The Hermosa salad was delicious and just slightly different from the usual.  The wine list was excellent, as was the variety of fresh breads.  We will not be returning.

KUuAZ53Yeu3_EZ1JALUe3Q.text: The patio at Lon's is one of my favorite places to eat. We had a great meal there for our anniversary. Started with El Diablo cocktail. Next was a salad with chocolate based dressing. Cowboy ribeye and followed with a cowboy candy bar for dessert. ALL were delicious.  Made for a memorable anniversary dinner.

AljAx4g_08ckkaGj_mjk_A.text: Nice atmosphere.  Has that old Scottsdale wealth tradition, the grounds are immaculate, and the host (or was he a manager?) gave me that snobbish "what are you doing here" look that you get in Scottsdale when you're not wearing an outfit that cost $400.  Seemed like this place was really for the people staying there and not so much for locals.  Plus the food was small proportions which was ok as it was not that great.  We went to McDonald's after instead of wasting more money on the food.  Drinks were good and the bartender/waitress was nice..

Zxfim0fX_vFIw0lM2jylQA.text: I went to Lon's with my mom for my birthday yesterday.  I hate to give this place a 3 star review, but good food alone just doesn't cut it.  The good: The menu is fabulous.  I wanted to try every single thing they offered.  So we went with the 5-course "trust" menu - good choice.  We started with a fabulous light and fresh tomato salad.  Then came seared Ahi with avocado (the fish was a bit overdone for me, but I like my ahi raw).  That was followed by a seared scallop with pesto, lamb with a delicious wine reduction, and refreshing little lemon tarts for dessert.  None of the wine pairings were particularly memorable, but they were all well-suited to the food.  The bad: The service.  Now, I grew up in AZ so I know things are a bit more laid back there, service is more casual, etc. - but this was ridiculous.  Our server seemed unhappy that we were choosing the tasting menu and tried to dissuade us, as if we didn't know it would take extra time.  When we held fast, she sort of sighed and got it started.  Not one dish was described when it was dropped, so we never knew what the sauces and garnishes were.  After clearing my plate before my mom's, the backserver just hovered next to her, waiting for her to take her last bite and grabbed the plate while she was chewing.  Also, everything was slooooow.  I mean, not a relaxing tasting pace, but a slow "kitchen forgot about us" pace.   I had really been looking forward to trying Lon's - I had heard such great things.  While the food did not disappoint, the service certainly did, and that really leaves a bad taste in my mouth.  I hope management picks up the pace at this place!

acCXWN3NUiKj7y4jzqmmJA.text: This is a great place to bring out of towners who think Phoenix is a hubble of sand. The patio is wonderful, the food is terrific, and the staff is helpful and not too "in your face fancy." Also- the wine list it to die for. Thanks for always making us have a good time, Lon's. You're a Phoenix, okay PV classic.

70D3BLQM405yedpvpZk1VA.text: If you don't know where Lon's happens to be, you can drive right past it...As I did.   As I walked into the restaurant, I first had to walk through the beautiful patio..wishing that my party had reserved to sit out there, but greatful we did not because it had to be Scottsdale coldest evening in a year!  The Ambiance of the restaurant was great, yes it was romantic but yet still inviting for larger parties.  We had a bottle of Champagne and Pinot Noir which was recommended by the sommelier.  For dinner, I had the pan roasted alaskan halibut  and the truffle scented mac and cheese...The halibut was nicely prepared and had a wonderful flavor.  The truffle scented mac and cheese was cold and not as tasteful as I hoped.  It was a disappointment.  For desert, we decided on the Chocolate cake with vanilla malt.    Overall, Lon's was a nice dining experience.  The only reason I would go back to the restaurant is for the outdoor patio.

QMMt7p2yfe7dHTOUq3bs8w.text: Very high quality food in a good atmosphere.  Didnt blow me away to get the 5th star and the service was terrible even though the restaurant was near empty.

Q_PdP9RFW-PryEpoocoi3g.text: Lon's is a classic, old time Scottsdale with a great bar, and atmosphere. they really put effort into New Years Eve. Our group of 4 -20 something's and 2 parents had good food, good service and a good wine program. Always a stop whenever we come to Scottsdale.

4khHgBWwEKjtDmfgi6RNZQ.text: I'll admit I was a just a bit nervous from some of the other yelps, and maybe our experience was a strike of lightning, but wow, my trip to Lon's was one of my best dinning experiences ever.  We made reservations for 6:30 on a Friday Evening and requested a table outside on the patio (Thanks to the great yelp advice) which was essential, you have to be on the patio when the weather allows.  So there we were seated, looking out of the quintessential south western landscape and off to the peak in the distance as the sun set across it.  The service was spectacular.  Almost too frequent of "check up."  You're not rushed at all because they aren't turning the tables on the balcony, the last seating is at 6:45.  The food was delicious, we had seared ahi tuna that tasted just right, and split an entree of a sea bass special.  Perfectly cooked.  We finished with a dense chocolate cake.  But we weren't really finished, not with the sun having seat and the fire place casting a glow.  We paid the check and spotted two great seats next to a fire pit.  The weather was perfect for it, just a slight chill in the air while we enjoyed some cool white wine.  I could see this place as a creating a super great romantic evening, as we did, but also coming for drinks with friends enjoying the night air, or in the winter, the inside is divided much like a lounge.  Great Vibe, great time... Lon's got it!

AqzqM-5QG0E8hIeWn66fXw.text: Let me start on a positive note. This is a charming restaurant. We arrived at 6:45 and our table was ready. When I made the reservation I let them know we had 2 vegetarians and that both couples were celebrating our 20th anniversaries. I wasn't very hungry so I decided to order a side of roasted summer squash.  I love squash but this was hardly edible, the skin was tough and the insides were mushy, I set the squash aside and ate the tomatoes and corn that were drowning in some white creamy sauce, there was supposed to be feta on this but I did not see it or taste it. Two people in of our party ordered the Taste of Summer.  They started with the crab stuffed squash blossom which lost it's flavor when they fried it.  It tasted like crab rangoon from any old chinese restaurant.  My husband had the roasted Petaluma chicken AZ cheddar mashed potatoes, broccolini, sweet onion jus.  The presentation of the chicken was just weird, it was a skin on chicken breast cut in half then placed over what appeared to be a thigh bone.  The meat was dry, the potatoes were average.  Our other dinner companion had the seared Scottish salmon braised baby fennel & artichokes, olives, citrus jus.  She ate half her meal because she didn't think it was very good.  The salmon was dry and lacked flavor. The one good meal on the table was the Alaskan halibut & Kauai shrimp, local farro, peas, green garlic, shaved radishes, chorizo broth. So if you are going I recommend this one.  The halibut was cooked perfectly and the farro was delicious.  We all tried each other's meals just to see if anything was as good as we had anticipated it would be.  We agreed on the halibut. We asked if there were vegetarian options for this meal (minus the chorizo broth) . Our waiter responded that it wouldn't be a problem and he saw the note that we had 2 vegetarians and 2 anniversaries. If he saw the note we should not have had to ask. However, when we ordered dessert they didn't write Happy Anniversary, light a candle or do anything.  They just brought the desserts out.  Our waiter was never around when we needed something, he appeard to be busy at large table across the room.  I waited 10 minutes to get a refill on my drink.   If this review was based solely on dinner and ambiance, it would easily be 4 stars. However, the service was pretty bad, especially for a $100+ meal. The waiter was friendly but a bit abrupt, beyond slow, and inattentive. Manny the guy who filled the water and cleaned the table was extremely attentive and friendly.  We had to ask him for more bread and to find our waiter at one point. We ordered the cobbler special and received this peach thing that was in a crust so hard someone could have chipped a tooth. Such a shame. It really is quite pretty in the evening with sparkling lights.  This meal was a huge disappointment because we heard so many wonderful reviews about the food & service we had pretty high expectations.  We will return to the resort because it's a beautiful place to get away to but next time I will drive down the street and go to Tarbell's.

3iMMOyOetcFfg5pW5TmEow.text: My husband brought me to Lon's for our 10 year anniversary. We enjoyed every minute of our visit there! First, you must sit on the patio if the weather permits. You are surrounded by gorgeous views of Camelback Mountain and a beautiful garden of flowers. Our server Brett along with all of his assistants provided a seamless experience. We highly recommend the beet salad! The beets were deliciously smoky. My husbands short ribs had incredible flavor. I enjoyed every bit of my lobster and shrimp! Go and enjoy the relaxing atmosphere!

4G8f3UutShRhI_2hjwrb6w.text: Nice experience and good food. Actually, truth be told, the experience was better than the hyped up food, but we had a good time. I guess that is what matters. Not sure how the food gets rated well..

az0044lLmRa9yMYoh_6F2g.text: Excellent from the first stop at the bar for a few drinks before dinner and on to superb service and wonderful food for our Anniversary. We had a beautiful spot in the dining room. We definitely will return in the fall so we can eat outside in their extraordinary patio. We received a very nice Anniversary card signed by all the staff and our meal was topped off by a sweet complimentary Anniversary dessert. Outstanding evening in every way. Definitely put Lon's on your dining experiences to try in Paradise Valley.

WriV-mxWs1aN3ooU4CEZtg.text: Enjoyed dinner with 4 neighbors/friends ordering the excellent salmon and short ribs however we needed to seek clarification as to the unknown collection of stuff accompanying the entrees...even the circulating manager wasn't sure...our waiter confirmed that the mystery mess was in fact brussel sprouts. Most disappointing was the Hermosa salad, the foundation of which was, as noted on the menu, "baby greens"...it looked like the vines associated with grapes (after the fruit was extracted) and was a challenge to cut and ingest. If that is their namesake salad I will opt for eating dried seaweed on a sun-drenched beach.  Lastly the Sommelier refused to take our initial drink order...Henry Ford would be proud of the "division of labor". Ironically, we found it necessary to ask a waiter to open the bottle of wine that we had on ice because we couldn't find the Sommelier. We won't be back!

D6BRtNoV6Z1NZvflVsXcEQ.text: Contrary to what one reviewer noted, Lon's does fail, especially at this price point.  We've had the pleasure of eating there on two other occasions when the service and culinary creations were spot on.  The current rendition of Lon's leaves much to be greatly desired.  Nutshell, the food and service slightly better than a national chain restaurant. Yes, really.  When we arrived early, we told the hostess that we wanted to enjoy a couple cocktails outside on the patio before dinner. Unfortunately that did not happen due to the very slow bar service with only two bartenders handling the whole restaurant.  One of the managers (which there appeared to be at least three roaming around) came by and asked about our drink order and said he will make sure it comes out expeditiously, but that didn't happen either.  The hostess kept asking if we were ready to go in, and the response was no, we would like to enjoy a couple cocktails before dinner, but were waiting patiently for them.  You'd think for how much you pay at this establishment that this would be a reasonable request....goodness, a patron wants to spend money on drinks!  We finally succumbed to the hostess when she said that her manager requested we take our table inside now.  Key to note here is that we did not want to sit outside on the patio, which was more in demand with the nice weather and live entertainment of a singer.  No, we specifically requested inside, as the ambience is very pleasant.  This encounter set the tone for the rest of the dinner, a folly if you will.  Once we got to our table inside, it was not a full.  I found this interesting since there was such a "hurry" for us to get to our table.  Our drinks arrived at the table, however my husband did not enjoy his, and no one asked how we liked them.  What did happen is the waiter saw we had full drinks and started to pressure us into getting down to business by selecting wine and dinner.  Now remind you, this is supposed to be a higher end restaurant that supposedly prides itself on service. I made a comment to the waiter that we are not in a rush and would like to enjoy our cocktails first and get settled into our evening, the menus, and wine selection.  Again, you'd think that this was a simple request, but not so.  The waiter came to the table again, slightly rushed in demeanor, asking if we were ready.  The response was no, and we are not in a hurry.  He said that's fine, as he has numerous other tables outside to handle.  Wow, such an odd response.  So not only is the bar short staffed, but now the wait staff, perhaps.    When we made it through our drinks, wine and dinner selections, we waited patiently for our waiter, as he traveled back and forth from the kitchen to the patio.  He did even stop by our table, our menus were closed, and asked if he could take one of the empty cocktail glasses away, but never asked if we were ready to order!  So odd and inefficient!  We watched the other waiter tend to his tables with more interest and desire to please.  We finally caught the waiter's eye and ordered.  The pinnacle dinner folly was when the food arrived.  They brought out the wrong meal for my husband.  We immediately advised the person delivering our meal (which was not our waiter) that he ordered something else.  The response by the deliverer was along the lines more negotiating if we would settle with what he brought, or would we rather wait for the correct dinner.  My husband responded with he'd like what he ordered.  Of course the waiter and one of the floating managers were notified, and the manager came over to apologize, and the waiter apologized and said something about his scribbled handwriting on the order.  So they took both plates back.  I ordered salmon, so now either my salmon was going to be cold, or slightly over cooked under a warmer while they corrected my husbands.  Most high end places would bring out completely fresh entrees for the patrons (at least that is my experience), but not the case.  I got the same dish back and my husband got his seabass.  Interestingly, when it was delivered, fairly quickly, the response was along the lines that someone else will  be waiting a bit longer for their dinner.  The portions were minuscule, especially the seabass.  It was not a good plate.  My salmon was just ok.  Honestly, the best highlight of the culinary creations were the little hushpuppy type rolls.  We never got an explanation of what the breads were, just plopped down the bread tray and moved on.  We narrowed down our dining selections to either Lon's or Durant's, and wished we went to Durant's.  As others noted, Lon's is not what it used to be, food is unremarkable and forgetful, and the service needs significant polishing (see review for The Henry/Matthew the wonderful waiter).  Obviously the owners and management are looking to make as much as they can off the dinner crowd and packing folks in.  Go elsewhere for service and food.

fuNqzI6R8t7cLhmyGZWFTA.text: We had the great fortune of having brunch at Lon's on 7/15/17 for a friend's birthday.  The monkey bread for starters was so darn good!  All four of us enjoyed our brunch entrees which were the huevos rancheros with chorizo on fry bread (x2), the pancakes and the steak frites.  Ryan, our server, gave us a wonderful tour of the restaurant making sure to point out the original building and artwork and even got us the key to go downstairs to the wine cellar.  Did you know you can eat down there during the summer with a well priced prix-fixe menu?  Because it was a bit overcast, we were able to walk the property and enjoy a "quick" game of life size chess.  Overall, a fabulous experience which will bring us back!

Dq3foRuB6VeLnl3nbBSuNg.text: This place has a beautiful ambiance and the food is very flavorful!   We split the tuna - so good! The heated salt block was a unique touch. The duck was good and very rich in taste.  Service was friendly and classy. They wear bolo's...that immediately gains points in my book.

photos.caption: Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Tuna on heated salt block

S4dywNcyAy7vnz4nCBMYXg.text: We went to this restaurant because we were told it has a beautiful outside patio.  We had a reservation but they would not sit us outside, even though there were a number of empty tables.   The blond hostess was rather firm and rude, insisting there were no patio tables available. Rather they put us inside in an empty room with two other tables with guests.  We speculate they needed to keep the inside waiter busy and could careless that we chose the restaurant because of the out door dinning.  The food was ok but would never go back because of the way we were treated!

H2RWgoAhYyXnIYQ1HORmcQ.text: Ate late afternoon lunch on a weekend at Lon's. The appetizer and burger I shared with my partner were amazing.. the drinks were also delicious, but the prices were pretty freakin high (completely expected for the area.)

_KYxGRFfYlwgYe0ya8qgDg.text: The atmosphere is so amazing! I got the strawberry salad which was amazing with chocolate vinaigrette-- must visit this place !

photos.caption: Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Nice
Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Western band
Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Strawberry salad and Cesar salad with Salmon

K3goMzqjkByzwZelHapYlQ.text: We decided to visit the restaurant while guests of the hotel. The service from the staff was outstanding. The meals were delicious, delivered in good time and were nice portion sizes. It was a great dining experience and would happily go there again while in Phoenix

tePHfJDv7c5adPsbdiaEyg.text: Nice western ambiance, servers were outstanding.  Ordered a fruit plate for breakfast and there was a lovely presentation of very little fruit.  Thank goodness I had ordered an appetizer to share when we were waiting for others.

AeHPPdwEduWBUKI9ned52A.text: For my wife and I, and a visitor from the East Coast, this could have been a memorable meal. The restaurant is beautiful. The service, with one notable exception, was quite good. The food, with one notable exception, was excellent. The management's decision-making, when it mattered, was regrettable. All was perfect until the entrees arrived. I had asked the waiter whether he'd recommend the short ribs ($34) or the filet mignon ($42). He suggested the former. It is almost impossible for short ribs to be tough and dry. But they were. It is all but unheard of for short ribs to be tasteless. But they were. The manager offered to fetch me a filet. I agreed, though I grumbled that it would arrive well after my companions had finished. Which it did. The filet was quite good. But as I ate and my companions watched, the waiter whisked away one of their wine glasses even though there was wine left in the very nice bottle of Tempranillo. When I was finished, we had no intention of ordering dessert. But the waiter announced that the manager would give us a complimentary dessert for the inconvenience. Then came the bill. They actually charged $42 for the filet, which replaced the inedible $34 short ribs. It's not the $8 I mind, really. It's the shortsightedness of that decision. Even at Lon's, repeat business = success. If I were the manager, I would have comped the entree because the three of us didn't really get to share a meal  because, on a Monday night, the kitchen was not at its best. Not my fault. But I paid for it.

sCNNbA9U2F2Jq1nstFEhBg.text: Lon's is beautifully decorated, amazing food and service! Our server Rodrigo took great care of us! We were having dinner for my mom's 60th, and Lon's had a birthday card for her hand signed by the staff and special touches on dessert. It was a five star experience! The live music was perfect, just the right volume - a great addition to the ambiance!

ijPkdnJfAeHmM3qtdkEcDA.text: Wow. This is the kind of place you recommend to out of town guests to ... 1) stay at  2) eat at.   Also, all local peeps should bust a gut and get over there.   STAT.  I'm told that if you wander over during peak season reservations are required *weeks* in advance.   That would NOT BE A TYPO. Weeks. So get that number on speed dial kids!  **Muy Importante** This is D.e.f.i.n.i.t.e.l.y a sweet date spot. Boy will you impress the ladies here!  The drive up to The Hermosa is just something. If you can come during the day. You'll really enjoy it. There are just so many beautiful homes to admire on the drive in. The road to the Hermosa is very quaint and rustic.  Walking into the patio area you're greeted by a beautiful fountain. (I had to stop for a photo, how could you not?) The outdoor patio is well lit for evening fun. No matter which way you look there is just something darling to admire. Architectural touches really have been thought out.   Indoors is adorable as well. We visited the bar area briefly (sadly - things to do!)  I can't wait to come back here!

photos.caption: Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Even the views on the way out are stunning. Beautiful design detail.
Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Beautiful outdoor grill and seating area.
Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States

ZEKLcDZBTfo9rlUxRtyLag.text: Dined al fresco here on Valentine's Day for brunch. The limited menu, watered down, overly iced white sangria,  and forgetful waitress (or chef- not sure which) are the only reasons I'm giving this establishment four stars instead of five.   It was otherwise very good.  I ordered the superfood salad with kale, pomegranate seeds, sweet potato, pistachio nuts, quinoa, and dried cranberries. I asked for sauteed salmon on the salad but out it came with no salmon unfortunately.   I was too hungry to send it back, so I ate it as is. It was excellent! So good in fact that I'm going to try and replicate this magic at home in my own kitchen!  I won't forget the salmon though. ;-)  The waitress did give me a free "birthday" dessert (despite the fact that it wasn't my birthday) to make up for the forgotten salmon, so that was nice. It was some sort of brownie entree. Not my fave, but it tasted pretty good.  I just wish they offered a few more non-meat centric items on the brunch menu for those of us who don't eat land animals.  Would definitely try for another meal here though- perhaps dinner. The hotel and grounds are absolutely lovely and the live music was a nice touch. Classy joint!

fpBmA1KfrQZ7vnL2sUZQog.text: It's hard to believe that I hadn't written a review for Lon's yet. We are somewhat regulars (at least once a month) for many years. During the spring and fall, the Patio is a hot reservation. And I mean...call a few days in advance hot.   I enjoy Sunday evenings at Lon's. Typically, they offer a price fixe menu and have different delicious meats (whole pig anyone?) roasting on a spit.   Saturday evenings offer a live band, and is great for evening dining.   If the patio is crowded and we don't have a reservation, we are happy to dine at the bar.   I always recommend Lon's to out of town guests. Tasteful, charming, a former artists residence, it gives a great taste of the Southwest in a well-appointed setting.  About the food? My favorites on the menu? Jidori Chicken (and I don't usually order chicken...BUT...this chicken is Amazing!); truffle macaroni and cheese, any of their fish selections. And the dessert: The Cowboy candy bar. You're welcome.

03qXd91kZNYF_boGfb5WMA.text: A party of four went there for an anniversary celebration. Two people had $34 short ribs which were delicious but very small servings of beef with nothing else on the plate except an over-fried piece of polenta. The other two had a $32 pork chop which was very dry and extremely bland (no flavor at all) served with a tiny braised yellow pepper spear and a tiny piece of charred fruit. They were also serving some other guests in the dining room a seafood dish that had an overpowering fish smell   Years ago Lon's was exceptional but the quality has slipped.  What a disappointment. But, hey, at least it was expensive!!

t241whDLT9rc9phcsm7ohg.text: Ate here this past week. Was last minute and we got a reservation for 3. Unaware of the beauty, we were a bit under dressed but no worries. Was made to feel right at home. We ate in the dining room, which was magnificent. Loved the entire feel of the inn. Our server, rachel was great and loved working at the Inn. She made some great suggestions. I had the tuna appetizer, which was great, served on a heated block of salt, and the sushi grade tuna served on top. You can cook it as little or as much as you want. Great w just a bit of sear on it. Then had the chicken, and was very impressed, great taste, juicy, and the cheddar mashed served with that great. In addition the sommelier made a great wine by the glass sggestion for the chicken, and paired perfectly. AND for dessert, can u believe a home made candy bar? Delicious. Would def go abck next time in the are..

46EJTNOGtNeqqcwrHPcGGA.text: My wife and I have been to Lon's many times, but last night was an unusual experience. On a very busy night, they couldn't find our reservation, booked on their own website which uses OpenTable. This made for an awkward start to the evening (I was pretty irritated). They then spent the next two hours trying to make it up to us by seating us next to the fireplace, comping my first glass of wine, and by providing outstanding service and excellent food. Not to mention apologizing at every opportunity. They really made us feel like they valued our business.  I think it's fair to say I forgive them. Oh, and when you book, ask for one of Dolores' tables - you'll see why.

QuzsIVUd7od6Gq46_aA6vA.text: Don't want to even give Lon's one star. Had dinner at Lon's in early August. It was highly recommended by the concierge of the hotel where we stayed. This is the worst restaurant meal I have ever had. There were twelve in our group and ten of the twelve meals were unacceptable. Not only were the entrees horrible the appetizers and desserts were equally bad. The food was bland and flavorless. For example my entree was served with truffle gnocchi. This should be full of flavor. The $49.00 steak was loaded with fat and cooked wrong. One of them was sent back, the other only partially eaten. Oh, and don't be fooled by the tuna on the lava rock...flavorless. When this was pointed out to the server and a manager they did not know how to handle the situation. I, as well as the concierge, contacted the food and beverage manager, Dave. He couldn't have been more rude. Said he would contact me and never did. Also, according to the concierge, he said he would contact her as well...never did. There are way too many good restaurants in this area to waste your money at Lon's and they don't appreciate your business. I would go to The Mission, Elements or Pizzaria Bianco over Lon's. AVOID  this restaurant at all cost!!!

lyCH4Sv1zAIgqTqO6QFecg.text: Food was fabulous.  Service was outstanding.  The fried calamari was really good...not outstanding but really yummy.  The heirloom salad was delicious but tiny (as expected).  The salmon and pork entrees were fabulous.  The meal was completed with a complimentary chocolate ganache that was the perfect ending to a wonderful meal.  The outside door where the wait staff entered and exited did provide a really chilly breeze that was slightly irritating but it was an unusually cold night.  Besides that issue the atmosphere was wonderful and romantic.

dNvqOJPgyHBpfGgzyY_Zcg.text: Patio was nice but that was it...service was slow (the woman was very nice when we saw her). Service and food made me think of being in a hammock. Relax, swaety, bored and somewhat comfortable.

M6MEoStPTF-pa9G-Ewwwzw.text: I can't recall a group business dinner anywhere that was better - 50 People - $8,000.00 and very good service and food.  If you have an event coming up ask for the Library, Wine Cellar or the Board Room  (and you have to visit) - we had too many people to use these rooms but our guests were treated like friends by Lon's and the food incredible - little touches of greatness that clients told us about weeks after the event was concluded.  I am in Scottsdale again in January and plan to make a dinner reservation this week. Thanks everyone at Lons!

YwaeR6HBkpLrDScJZu9WEg.text: Wow if you want to be wined and dined this is the place to do it at. I have not been in Phoenix all that long, but this is the best restauraunt in the valley. The combination of excellent service, delectible food, and ambiance off the charts makes this place great. There is nothing better than sitting outside, under the stars, eating locally grow gourmet food in this remote location. Actualy there is, drinking a glass of wine off of their spectacular wine list. Give this place a try for a very romantic dinner with excellent food.

koRc-56TAwTWhwZ_tOXHvg.text: My husband and I took a chance last night and went to Lon's. We had no reservations and opted to sit outside and the bartender waited on us.  We were able to enjoy the beautiful Arizona cool evening and have a drink prior to ordering. I had a glass of Pinot and loved it. My husband had a $12 Grey Goose and tonic, easy on the GG. The sommelier assisted him with which wine to order for his pork tenderloins with chutney. I had the special, blue nose seabass ( I was hoping for the red nose, I guess they were out of season). We had the yellow tomato soup and best part was the grilled cheese piece of heaven. I could have had a whole meal of that goodness. The bread was light and crispy and the cheese was melt in your mouth (I believe) goat cheese.  The food was promptly served and we enjoyed every bite. We had to have the dessert, which included tastes of tiramisu, creme brulee and chocolate napolean. I ranked the creme brulee #1, tiramisu #2, my husband gave the number 1 to the tiramisu.  We will definitly be back and this time with reservations. The burning fire wood, which we sat near, had us smelling like we were at a lake kegger by the end of the evening.

ghgK61qg2ilBAev2LIe5rQ.text: I had almost the same bad experience as another reviewer.  This used to be a good restaurant but I think it is resting on its past glory.  The atmosphere is still great.  The surrounding is beautiful.  However, the food has gone downhill.   My girlfriend and I went there to celebrate her birthday.  We ordered the calamari appetizer.  It tasted nothing like calamari.  It was more like some kind of fish and it was soft, just like fish.  The sea bass I ordered was very average.  They throw in a few sticks of something to make it look presentable.  But, for $30 an entree' I expected something better. Since this is my girlfriend's birthday, I thought they would be decent enough to bring a small piece of cake or dessert to help her celebrate.  Guess what?  The waiter has the gall to bring 2 teeny pieces of chocolate with a candle on the plate.  I almost wanted to throw it back at him.  This is an insult, after spending more than $100 on the bill, all they can give you is 2 tiny pieces of chocolate?  Even Denny's will give you a free breakfast on your birthday.  It shows that this restaurant has no class. Save your money and go to any of the new restaurants with an up and coming chef.  Some place where they really want your business.

WoYvc2eXvBSKJvqio6iuOg.text: Another romantic spot.  I haven't been in a while... but I have always enjoyed my meals in the past.  Southwestern influenced cuisine.  Beautiful patio.  Great service.

AnGqJajmMrSZxnqUbmlr_A.text: Last two visits to Lon's were a disappointment.  Server was rushed with too many tables.  My salad plate was cleared with my cutlery and not replaced.  Everyone was served their entree and I had nothing to eat with!  When I tried to catch the attention of my server, he ignored me!  Finally told everyone to start without me.  I finally snagged a passing busboy to accomodate me.  My last visit, I ordered the barrata cheese salad which I've had here before and was luscious.  This time the cheese was the consistency of a glob of paint on a paint lid.  Chewy and hard.  I sent it back and they microwaved the cheese to make it gooey!!  Awful mess.  I have always recommended this place for its ambience and food.  The latter and the service are amiss.  Will have to be convinced that they have improved greatly before I return!

1iNuV9faBTf3Tg6BjZlYRw.text: My Mom, Sister and I spent a few days in Scottsdale last week.  Lon's was wonderful!  The service was excellent and the food was great.  Ask to see the wine cellar.    It's amazing!

WybCOXO8INStJ15_6UxH2A.text: Went to Lon's on a date.  Can't say much for the guy, but the food was really good.  The atmosphere is very romantic and if the weather is nice, I recommend sitting out on the patio.   The best risotto I've ever had was at Lon's.  It was a kalamata risotto and it was awesome. They also have a really good sweet potato risotto. The food is southwestern and I was told that Lon's is Arizona's last remaining authentic hacienda.  That's pretty cool.    Not a place for small kids, but if you hit up Lon's with someone you actually like (don't make the same mistake I did), you'll have a great time.

OuJAy4YiKfbo75ODvwQG3A.text: I ate here recently with my wife, mother in law, and 3 month old son.  We ate inside, which was pleasant.  Outside looked more enchanting, but I'm not used to the Phx heat....even in April.  :-)  Anyway, the food was above average but a little underwhelming considering the price.  The service (again, for the price) was bush league.  Our server, although he tried, was unorthodox, unpolished and generally a little nervous.  I expected more from a place like this.    Hope this helps you make your decision.  I think we got stuck with a lame waiter.

wT6uzyv7Yp27dSABqJ1YzA.text: We'e been to Lon's several times. Each time is a wonderful experience. This time was exceptional because we had a bit of a special request. We have been converting over to a more vegan diet and try to eat that way most of the time. My honey made a reservation for the Tuesday Trust Table which is where you trust the chef to create a five course menu for you while the sommelier pairs them with wines. We were lucky enough to get the entire wine cellar to ourselves. The chef did accommodate our vegan request which a lot of places find annoying and many won't even do it. So this was awesome. The cellar was gorgeous and nice and cool in the desert heat. The courses for the Tuesday Trust Dinner are served by the executive chef Jeremy Pacheco. Because it was a slow night, he actually spent a little time to talk foodie stuff with me. Yep, I was in heaven! Each course was creative, fresh, colorful and delicious. The sommelier did an outstanding job with the parings. Our server was top notch. I have a more complete review of the evening with pictures on my blog. vegintraing.blogspot.com The pictures and the descriptions don't do it justice. I agree with one of the other reviews that when the weather is right, you should absolutely sit out on the patio. It is gorgeous. Outstanding service, food, and ambiance. Go!

BFgXVT7IBPnKOmITp_UogA.text: Excellent as usual. Terrific food, atmospher, and service.

fkdtFal3-kuFD-zjLp1Jvw.text: Made the mistake of eating here on 10/24. Hostess and maitre de set the tone wrong with their completely haughty and unwelcoming approach when we arrived. Acted like they were doing us a big favor by letting us eat there.   Wine list is extensive but outrageously overpriced. We selected a good bottle (90 points WS) and when we asked the self-labeled "wine guy" about it, he said, "I actually can drink that." A snobby comment.   Food was completely uninspired and pedestrian. Nothing special here.   Service fair, pace was bad between courses - long waits.   Had a meal the night before at T Cooks -it was extremely better in every single category. Lon's gets by on it's nice patio setting. The food is average at best. Go to T Cooks instead.  If you do go here, call long ahead and at least get a decent table on the patio.

e-KLemfWAyEsOSZO2WYEfg.text: What a wonderful meal.  I had a fish stew that had scallops, shrimp, and talapia.  Who would have thought of going to Arizona for great seafood?  Lon's is a really fun and interesting restaurant right in the middle of a residential neighborhood.  We toured the grounds and the wine cellar and had a wonderful time.  I'll go back.

7DJr2TFh_-P0K2AljzHPAQ.text: Although the restaurant atmosphere and outdoor seating is nice, the food was simply underwhelming. My wife and I tried the grilled shrimp and octopus cocktail which tasted like it had been frozen (and no evidence of any of it being grilled) and the flavor was just ehh, and the proscuitto wrapped veal entree was just as uninspiring. Well cooked but borrring. The fact that you pay $35 for an entree and may need to add additional sides is a bit unnerving as well. Good, attentive service but if you are a foodie, I would try elsewhere.

-pk_YE5P5x-PXGWKGOWKdA.text: Best Short Ribs in town!  Great place!

BsJjpJgA2a8iZ6rozig1IA.text: We went here in March for my Father's birthday, when we made the reservation, we let them know. There are 3 big men in my family and they stuck us in some corner table that was hard for them to get in and out of. Our waiter was a man named "Brian" who was pretty sharp and rude. By the time we got there, it was late, we had a 9pm reservation so perhaps he had a long night. But my mother asked him to repeat something and he yelled "would you like some water?" It was pretty annoying because my mother is not hard of hearing or anything, she just didn't understand what he was asking. The food was mediocre. Anyway our friends had recommended this restaurant so highly that we were pretty disappointed. The waiter got a little nicer by the end of the dinner, but he had started out so bad, that we weren't impressed. Normally I would chalk this up to perhaps just the waiter having a bad day, but it just really isn't the most welcoming establishment. The restaurant does have a lot of ambiance and the outside area looked fantastic, but service plays a big part in where I would like to eat.

cjmulaA7H0geAOAHVu0FEA.text: Went here with the fam for brunch on a Sunday morning and sat on the patio. It was a beautiful day and they had umbrellas at each table to provide shade. They are also dog friendly, we brought our long hair dachshund Winnie. My sister had her girls there and she ordered pancakes for both of them which were really yummy. Each plate was 3 stacks so they had plenty to share. We started with the monkey bread which was unreal. I highly recommend. We also shared the avocado toast which was good. I had the wagyu burger, very good. My wife had chicken club, and I had a couple bites of that as well. Also very good. Finally, can't forget the chipotle bloody that really hit the spot. Nothing wrong with a little hair of the dog, amirite? Oh and can't forget the great service! Spot on.

KeHSqmpf_ccJYhU_ZfQPJw.text: I was so looking forward to brunch at Lon's today, after an amazing dinner there in December. The setting is gorgeous, but the drinks and service were abysmal. I sent back two mimosa that tasted like what drain cleaner must, and asked for a glass of Roederer champagne. Received a glass of Rodney Strong Chardonnay???? I just gave up and had water lol. The sizzling bacon appetizer was too fatty for my liking, but my omelette was good-no pic, sorry. Our table was not cleared until we got our check. I don't know if they were short staffed or what...but certainly didn't meet expectations.

photos.caption: Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Oh come on....no dishes cleared until after the check
Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States
Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Sizzling bacon

S_h4eV1_0SGr16q97q8QVA.text: My husband took me to Lon's for my birthday dinner, and everything about the experience was absolutely perfect. This restaurant (and the adjacent bar) have the most gorgeous outdoor seating, the service is perfect and the food! Oh my, the food. I am incredibly selective when it comes to restaurants and I usually prefer to make my own creations at home, but the cuisine here was exquisite. We shared the marinated goat cheese curds, the fire roasted olives and the raw & pickled seasonal veggies as an appetizers, I had the ribs as a main and the signature candy bar (which was generously gifted on the house!) for dessert. Everything was so delicious. I highly recommend this restaurant for a romantic dinner or celebration. We'll be back.

i_XOSs96i6V7RpTj7a3NKA.text: Just enjoyed lunch at Lon's! Food was yummy! Our server, Brian, was outstanding!  A great way to start out the New Year!

LlocTe_KpSjqZhGQ6-MLOQ.text: We were seated outside in the courtyard area. The lighting was lovely, they had space heaters for comfort, loved the live music. The food was delicious, attractive presentation that is suitable for sharing. Lon's is a wonderful choice for a romantic dinner date.

TvFmnDoCpyEBlJ8aiwk2xQ.text: My favorite lobster is here. Delicious food, amazing cocktails, and beautiful setting. I wish the staff was a little friendlier, the bartender and server we interacted with were a little stiff and overly formal.

b_dXhQ8GqTI8UvhqNCxOeQ.text: Great ambiance! This is a great place to eat and the decor makes it even better. The service here is great. We came for Christmas brunch and they had a prefixed menu. All the food was very good!   I would think this would be a great place to get drinks.   Valet parking is kind of a joke as they literally park the car 20 feet away.

q50ptvPOdeAOTnzw0bEvrw.text: Great boutique hotel for a wonderful Sunday brunch the blue crab eggs Benedict was incredible!

Nt-w3f8mPTTrFNkg4cYuMA.text: This is probably one of the most lackluster experiences I have had from a restaurant in a while.  When we sat down at our table everything was fine and then it took a turn for the worst.  A few minutes into the dining experience management decides to seat a group of old obnoxious/loud women at a large table next to where we were seated.  The couples that were seated around us seemed annoyed by this as well.  Our waiter was decent in the beginning of the meal and then it was almost like he forgot about us and never asked us how our main entree was tasting.  I do have to say the bus staff were on top of their game by making sure the table was clear when you were done and making sure your water was full.  Also,  I thought the meal itself was flavorful and fresh.   We all took advantage of the restaurant week menu which was a good deal for right amount of food.  So, overall the food was good and the bus staff was excellent but the service and management is something to be desired especially since we were celebrating a special occasion.  This is the main reason for such a low rating.

Hx7kGG_BTvPWb2P-k9xlnQ.text: I have fond memories of the Hermosa Inn back in the late '90's before the bubble burst. My company at the time used to let me stay here in one of the charming adobe casitas with the romantic fireplace. Now granted I was alone and without, ahem, equipment, but still it was a lovely spot. Now nearly twenty years later, I was given the task of finding a dining spot for a couple of colleagues and myself on a Monday evening. Now as you know, most fine restaurants are closed on Mondays, so for some reason, I flashed back on the Hermosa and then I recalled a restaurant scene with Whitney Houston in "Waiting to Exhale". Shoop, shoop...anyway, that's how I found Lon's...seriously. As we were awaiting our third colleague, we strolled around the adobe-laden grounds which still had that southwestern allure I recall. As we entered the small bar and then the dining room, we noticed the decor was upscale cowboy ranch which I couldn't make up my mind was retro-chic or just faded old-school (photo: bit.ly/2f4fwXI). No matter as It turned out to be Arizona Restaurant Week, so we each took advantage of the three-course dinner available for $44 (photo: bit.ly/2eZzFzE). It started with a cutting board full of bread of which I took extreme liberties with the tasty mini-cornbread muffins (photo: bit.ly/2eQv4ig). My first course was the Crab-Stuffed Squash Blossoms in which the crab was mixed liberally with an aji Amarillo aioli. It was accompanied by bits of avocado, grape tomato halves and spicy sprouts (photo: bit.ly/2frXa7j). Good though rather tiny in portion for even an appetizer. My entree was the hefty Dry-Aged Heritage Pork Chop served with a hash made of yams, corn, hatch chiles and a swoosh of mole (photo: bit.ly/2dRVfse). While the pork was tender and succulent, the hash was somewhat disappointing since it tasted rather dry considering the interesting mix of flavors. We did on a satisfying sweet note sharing a trio of desserts - the Chocolate Caramel Tart with Salted Caramel Gelato (photo: bit.ly/2f1fEIw), Buttermilk Panna Cotta with Mango Curd and Coconut Sorbet (photo: bit.ly/2dZiRGj); and Lon's Signature Cowboy Candy Bar with chili-spiced ganache and hazelnuts (photo: bit.ly/2emUuTW). Bites of these confections allowed the meal to end on a high note even if I'm not a fan of cowhide chairs. FOOD - 3 stars...presentations are nice but quality is variable hovering around hotel banquet level AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...the grounds are lovely, but the interior feels kinda dated with its traditional southwest decor SERVICE - 3.5 stars...attentive if a bit unctuous TOTAL - 3 stars...shoop, shoop

photos.caption: Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Dining room
Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Bread selection
Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Maker&#39;s Mark &amp; Ginger

SPkUxPRwvYB2d5uGguY53g.text: Lon's interior has the cliche southwest cowboy theme for the tourists.  This was off-putting for me, and I never dined at Lon's until recently.  Looks are so deceiving.
