Yes, the interior of the restaurant is a little kitschy, but the food and service are first rate.  If you arrive early, you'll wait at the little bar off to the side.  The servers at the bar are attentive and quick.  When you're seated in the main dining room, the servers are once again attentive and very gracious.  The menu changes with the seasons and they try to emphasize locally sourced ingredients.  The portions aren't huge and the flavoring is very delicate.  Also the presentation of some of the food is surprisingly detailed.  Their 2018 Fall menu features a Spanish octopus carpaccio.  The octopus was so tender and sliced so thin!  It was delicious. I had their black cod as my entree and it was also lightly flavored and delicious.  Their deserts are once again small and delicate.  The table shared 2 desserts, a date-pecan cake and a pumpkin spice cheesecake.  Light, airy, almost makes you believe you're not eating dessert.  It's a wonderful restaurant, and I highly recommend it to discerning diners.

StoJ5PyjzctIZjQoU3rpqw.text: Lon's is amazing, I think it is my favorite special occasion restaurant in the Valley (at least near the very top of the list!).  The gardens, patios and views are perfect Arizona, giving the feel of old-Phoenix getaways!  From the moment the valet takes our car we start to feel like we are someplace special.  A very friendly welcome and greeting from the hostess, and we are led to our table where everything from the appetizers to the wine and entrees was amazing.  Our waiter, Troy, did a great job at both casually suggesting and educating menu items, and taking care of us throughout our dinner.  The tuna appetizer searing on the block of salt was amazing, along with the filet and braised short ribs!  At the end of our dinner, there was no urgency to rush out, we enjoyed the last of our wine followed by a stroll through the patio back to our car.  We are looking forward to our next visit to Lon's.

a_9L6HVFlIzgqBRpL7tIeg.text: We had dinner last night. Starts out took 30 extra minutes to seat our party.  Then no communication to status.  I know we were and 830p party but some communication helps.  Once seated took another 30 for first course. Then another 30 mins to get a cold steak. Instead firing a new steak they simply put mine back on and fired it until burnt.  Could even eat it. By then it was 1030p.  Biggest issue was no manager to apologize. Will never be back.

bswueD_ehtsq9OXLZAWZYQ.text: I was waiting for my daughter to join me at Lon's.  I was sitting where the manager could not see me.  My daughter arrives, she tries to open a door that was locked and the manager told his staff "Look how stupid she is -she can't open the door and wearing a Yale sweatshirt"!  They all laughed at my daughter.  I was beyond furious!  Now, it is not only in poor taste and highly unprofessional....they never took into consideration if my daughter has a disability.   My daughter was judged and laughed at.  Discrimination at its highest!  There are much better places to frequent while visiting Arizona.

Kmurp_vprxosgGVwDDomEg.text: It pains me to say, Lon's has degraded. I treated my parent's and a friend to Christmas Dinner. Ambiance on the patio was lovely, as usual. Sadly, the food was mediocre. As a vegetarian, I chose the mushroom risotto. This dish was inedible due to the intense saltiness. Thankfully, the bread was superb. Waiter forgot the wine...twice. Desserts were uninspired. Overall, a disappointing experience. Normally, I would chalk it up to a one time miss, however, this is the third time I've had a poor experience within the last year. After enjoying this restaurant for 10+ years, I don't see a return in the future

DaLM_uzXn6Ixc-hfBCbFLA.text: Robust and delicious menu. Attentive and pleasant wait staff. Beautiful setting and lovely gardens. This place is great! Also, the prices are not crazy for such a nice restaurant!

s4HWaRtJCZOhE-ij7YSNMA.text: Where do I even start with this place??  From the amazing service to the incredible ambiance and food, all around a fantastic experience.  My husband and I went for our anniversary and had a wonderful dinner accompanied by roses and a hand written card on our table. Everyone who came to our table to drop off wine, food, refill our water wished us a happy anniversary. The food was amazing, best Brussels sprouts I've ever had in my life, shrimp risotto was on point and the truffle fries were delicious.  The patio is beautiful and there was live music quietly playing as well, dreamy views of camelback mountain and perfect weather.  My husband and I both mentioned how blown away we were by the service. I can't even get over how great and courteous the staff was!   We will for sure be going back!!

T6ATPIzl0o4orz2HowJfJQ.text: We made reservations to celebrate a birthday, expecting to eat outside. However, it was very cold and breezy so elected to eat inside. There was NO disappointment! The table and service were both excellent. We arrived early to start our celebration at the bar. My husband loved his Manhattan and we all enjoyed the very friendly, professional bartenders. They were both attentive and fun!  When we were seated at our table in the dining room, the waiter greeted us as if we were long lost friends and the most important people in the dining area!  He was friendly, non intrusive and guided us through the menu. The appetizers were amazing as were our meals and desserts. Presentation, fresh ingredients and creative menu choices are all key and we certainly give our thanks to the chef who continues to surpass our expectations with each visit. Can't wait to go back!  Definitely a must whether your looking to celebrate a special occasion or simply enjoy a great meal.

AC-iOlgV3fGDHVrqJD1aoA.text: Such a great little spot - good fun food and a great place to sit outside and enjoy the weather in a pretty secluded garden.

9oe1zpfYYdBe2b5dLkVvBQ.text: I loved everything about Lon's. The atmosphere is perfect. Low-key, beautiful, great lighting, cozy, clean. The bartenders were friendly and generous with our drinks. We had a delicious, romantic meal. Every single thing we ate was made perfectly. I especially loved the ahi on salt block. We also had wagu, broccoli, and French fries...and we had the tortilla soup which was to die for. The service was flawless. Highly recommend!

--jWGjU1hvW8OvIO1gpIKA.text: Lon's has a new lunch menu, featuring smaller portions with lower prices.  This is perfect for me!  You can use this to make an a la carte approach, and so get what you really want.  Try a pork belly taco and the spinach salad.  This is great!

BgQI_0BId-gjDiLxk847_A.text: Ambiance and setting were superb. Food was great. Service was very, very good. My wife has food allergies which will stymie all but the very best waitstaff. Our server warmed up to the task and she soon had some truly delicious braised short rib in front of her. I enjoyed an awesome preparation of Halibut with Mexican shrimp and chorizo.  Throughout the meal we commented on how beautiful the patio and dining room must be once the weather cools and into the Holidays. We'd love to bring our three daughters and their Significant Others!

FS2WA5tYIWIsOSz7yTTdhA.text: Unparalleled.  Beautiful setting, excellent food, superb service, and a memorable evening for myself and my fiancee.

-i2qQ2SkGpbLvcSuXvvzeQ.text: Pricy but oh so Devine !   Setting,  environs, kiva fireplaces...live music....extordinary    The chicken perfectly cook...how do they get the skin so crisp and tasty??!!  The steaks can be very undercooked at least one level below what you request. Medium rare is more like beef tartar without the preparation.   At these prices don't feel shy about asking to get it right.   Highly recommend go, enjoy, emerge

-k2SUzuLhBowlGJA3qepMw.text: Lon's is always amazing for drinks and apps under the stars. You can't beat scenery and the location and they have good happy hour pricing.

y1UsaJbZ1oqH3U2kY7geTA.text: The ambiance is wonderful when seated outside.  We were there with another couple celebrating our anniversaries, and were each greeted with a "Happy Anniversary" card.  Our server, James, appeared shortly after we were seated and told us about the special lobster omelet (though none of us ordered it, it sounded delicious).  The food was very good; all fresh and flavorful.  We then got a tour of Lon's with a short history lesson, which was fun, and then lucked into a visit to the wine cellar as well, where you can have a meal for up to 12.  The grounds are gorgeous, the food yummy and the atmosphere relaxing...LOVED IT HERE and will return.

6aKURJRNg7GedTpzS9Dglg.text: Our experience here tonight was excellent. James was an attentive, charismatic, and knowledgeable server, and the ambiance of the restaurant was warm and welcoming. Looking forward to our next visit.

2CBWTLwuz6dCmi-ugEhoYg.text: Wow can you say amazing new entrance!!!  OK now to the food might seem pricey but the lobster is outstanding.. let's go on to the wine list insane..  cheers

0BcB0_2ebbcFX8civ1ACxA.text: We had brunch at Lon's today for my parents anniversary. It was a really nice experience. Unfortunately, we were unable to sit on the famed patio because it was rainy, but we loved the Southwestern motif of the dining rooms, complete with the kiva fireplaces. The art on the walls, is obviously, fabulous.   We started with the *Monkey Bread*. It was delicious. Absolutely yummy! Very sugary- it was actually swimming in syrup and frosting, and then covered with pecans. How decadent. I actually ate a 3rd of the dish, and was almost completely full. I didn't leave myself enough room for the *Chopped Salad* full of fresh vegetables. I got it without the turkey and cheese, but I'm assuming if you like that kind of thing, it would add something to the dish. They were very good about subbing a hardboiled egg for the turkey. It was dressed lightly with a cilantro vinaigrette, and had the crunch of pumpkin seeds throughout. I was really surprised with how generous the portion was. Lon's isn't about charging a good amount for a little bit of food, they pile it on!  My parents both got the *Lemon Ricotta Pancakes*. They weren't anything like the pancakes you are used to. They are circular and tall, but not in the least bit dense. The compote served along with them was the perfect compliment to the lemon of the lemony whipped cream and pancake. They probably could have spit an order, as they both had leftovers!  My husband got the *Lon's Club*. He complimented the bread, being a little harder on the outside and soft and warm on the inside. It was piled high with chicken breast, ham, cheese, avocado and aoili. It came with a side of either salad or french fries and their famous apple slaw. He chose the french fries, which I was very happy about because they were perfectly cooked, and really well seasoned... I stole more than a few. He said the apple slaw was refreshing. It had raisins in it as well.   We can't wait to go back to Lon's. The cost of the brunch was very reasonable. $74 without tax or tip. 4 entrees, and a starter, coffee and tea.

ZnJLLyj8a4bTTq5FBwmVfg.text: Awesome patio and great quiet/intimate ambiance! The food is also great - lots of truffles, which I love. They also do fish very well for Phoenix and have great guacamole.

lkk4p0AxMSESyhHE6Dv6jA.text: On a normal night this place would've been way too upscale for my liking, but for some reason the Sunday evening before Labor Day wasn't busy. We weren't dressed for the class of this restaurant, but we were welcomed without judgement. We began with a cocktail in the bar. Stetson decorated, hipster Libationists, interesting concoctions of infused liquors set the tone for a memorable experience! Once seated in the restaurant, we were greeted by a professional waiter (which I love). We began with the tuna appetizer which you sear right at your table. For starter I had the fig and pecan salad...amazing! Our group chose a variety of entres including salmon, pork and short ribs. All served beautifully and tasted divine! Although we were stuffed we had to try their deconstructed snickers bar for desert.........LOVED IT! Do not pass on desert here! At the end of our evening the Valet had already brought our car around as he heard us talking in the courtyard so when we walked it out it was waiting! I highly recommend Lon's for a special occasion or to make any occasion special!

photos.caption: Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Jack Rose, infused Margarita, and Karen&#39;s regular Vodka
Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States

DuxIsaPpmn3PhG2rzqlFhQ.text: We went to Lon's for appetizers and drinks (which served as our dinner) with Arizona friends who know their way around. The outside patio seating area is beautiful, with flowers, soft lights, and couches to relax in. The live entertainment that night was perfect for us baby boomers. We benefitted from happy hour pricing and enjoyed a variety of appetizers, all of which were tasty. Our waitress was terrific -- very patient with us as we jockeyed our way to a preferred seating area -- and she chatted with us just enough to be friendly without being obtrusive. Being outside on a spring evening as twilight descended was magical. (Well, maybe with the exception of the ill-mannered bird perched in a tree over our seating area!)

GpCF__5pfYfqf0mV8JXjZQ.text: Had brunch at Lon's the day after Valentine's Day.  The menu is not extensive, but the food is amazing.  My wife had the crab cakes.  They were made with virtually no - or no- filler at all.  They were perfectly done and excellent.  I had the steak frites.  The fries were very good, the greens were beautifully dressed in a very lemony dressing, and the steak was one of the most flavorful I have ever had.  The chimichurri seasonings were perfect and the chef prepared it a perfectly medium-rare, just as I ordered it.  Service was spectacular - so friendly and so professional.  We were so impressed that we cancelled a dinner reservation we had for this coming Friday just so we could go back to Lon's.  As an aside, there were two children at a table next to us outside, and there is almost nothing on the brunch menu for kids.  The server told the two that he could do anything they wanted, even plain pancakes with syrup on the side.  I don't know what they eventually ordered, but I impressed that they offered to do "anything" for the children.  The atmosphere on the patio was wonderful, as was the live guitar music.  In all, one of the most memorable brunches we have ever had.

bd9wYqOLWclnOMCsE-jWpw.text: Service and atmosphere was great.  Did a relaxing lunch.  Calamari was good, but wish the marinara wasn't hidden below.  Soup was excellent.  Chopped salad was a disappointment.  Wasn't as described on menu.  Great wine list and great place to take someone special.

cTJQQURzZ0eVTWB4U6nymQ.text: Had a fabulous dinner and breakfast here. What's really great is the small menu that will satisfy hearty eaters and dieters. High quality with commensurate pricing.

photos.caption: Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States

0jYbio8gnZZB14NFwzWwqQ.text: Nothing compares to Lon's patio. The atmosphere, service and food are superb. We've been there as a couple and with a small child. We've been there on weekends, weekdays and holidays. Each time, the staff catered to our needs perfectly. It is upscale without being snooty. It's expensive but feels like a good value. I can't recommend it strongly enough. The only catch is that you need to request the patio when you make your reservation. Otherwise, you may get stuck inside. Inside is like a different restaurant. The food and service are still good, but the few times we've dined inside, we've found it to be a step down from what we've received on the patio. And the atmosphere inside is dark and dated. So, just request outside, and you're good to go.

PLL9LQYTfwbw37MX88SzZg.text: Had a delightful late lunch on the patio. The ahi burger was perfect, shrimp Louis salad had wonderful greens perfectly dressed. Service was impeccable (Ivan). Can't wait to do dinner here.

_fm6QDDYdnaZcaII40nDaw.text: This place is Fn amazing.   The boy took me here for my birthday dinner, and literally, I cannot think of any other place I would have rather been at. We went late, 9pm rez, It was an amazing evening so we sat outside near the fireplace. You seriously have to sit outside, it's almost like you're in another state on vacation with how secluded it is. Each table gets its own heat lamp too, by the way. We started with a bottle of Champagne and the sommelier there was so cool. Loaded with suggestions and just a really friendly dude. We also started with the Mussels and Foie Gras - both equally amazing. The mussels were delicious.. I LOVE mussels, and ever since I left Boston, I haven't had any good ones.. these were awesome. I wanted more. The Foie Gras was obviously delicious..  Prepared to perfection and it was gone in less than 30 seconds.   For our entrees, I got the lamb and B got the Beef Tenderloin. For our sides we got the Mac n Cheese & Grilled Asparagus. I'm not even kidding when I say that we did not leave ONE bite on our plates. We devoured everything, and all of it was perfect. Especially the bottle of wine we split with it.  To wrap up the meal, we got the creme brulee to share, and as my photo shows, they personalized it for my special day. That along with 2 glasses of port, and we were good to go..   Staff don't mess around, they are at your beck and call from the moment you pull up to valet.   I will say this place is not cheap, and seemingly only appropriate for special occasions, however, I will absolutely go back again and again and again, birthday or not. Seriously one of the most delicious dinners ive ever had, period.

photos.caption: Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Happy Birthday to me!

pHcUaQsbQ0PsWFUUXvYTNw.text: We were recently subjected to the enormous disappointment and displeasure of having brunch at Lon's, this despite the beautiful, enchanting setting.   In short, both the service and food were abyssmal.   Although we had a reservatioin, upon arrival our reception was far from cordial and/or welcoming.  It was as if we were somehow unexpected and/or an annoyance.  Once we were seated in the garden, we waited a very long time until our waiter, looking quite dishelveled, finally arrived.   Although he was cordial, he seemed rather uncertain and had some difficulty understanding our order; in fact he returned to the table twice to review what we had ordered.  He subsequently proved to be quite inept in the most rudimentary tasks, as well, reaching across the table in front of one guest to place something before another guest (twice), touching clean silverware at the tines and blades rather than the handle, and disappearing for long stretches of time until we went looking for him (twice).       We ordered drinks and water first.  The drinks arrived after a considerable wait, but no water accompanied them.  Finally, after mentioning the water to our waiter three times, and then to other employees twice, we finally received a bottle of water which was not adequate for the four of us.  When the food arrived, with the exception of the kale salad, it proved to be very disappointing.  My husband ordered huevos rancheros, but what he received hardly conformed to the traditional Mexican dish, which generally consists of scrambled eggs liberally laced with chorizo and salsa.  What he received was a piece of something called "fry bread" (a kind of limp, tortilla-like concoction) covered with a very modest layer of refried beans mixed with a bit of tasteless ground meat that had absolutely no resemblance to chorizo;this was topped with a single fried egg.  I ordered the short rib hash, which was no better.  It was dry and tasteless, and the poached eggs were also tasteless and too well done.  A single piece of cold toast with the tiniest amount of butter accompanied the dish.  Although I did enjoy my salad, I had expected and certainly would have appreciated some bread or crackers;however, we received none.  In both our cases, and that of our friends' entrees, we were surprised at the very meager portions.        Although we have lived in Scottsdale for many years, we travel extensively, both for business and pleasure, in the U.S. as well as in various European countries, often spending 3-4 months per year away from home.  Hence, we have experienced a wide variety of cuisines in any number of restaurants at various price points, and based on our experience, we believe we are absolutely justified in judging the food and service at Lon's to be absolutely sub-standard.  It's a pity that in this truly unique and inspiring setting, no one seems to know  enough, or perhaps to care enough about the essential purpose of the place.

k4l6czHrm4_mWgEzMIH7AA.text: We went here for AZ restaurant week menu. I guess I expected a much greater experience based on how much this place is raved about! Very mediocre for the $$$! This dinner was nothing I wouldn't get at a standard hotel chain restaurant. Dessert was the biggest disappointment. Pre-made and blah. Only thing going here is the ambience. Don't expect much more than that!

XuXL5g-ii4hb69YE4HV_-Q.text: This was indeed up there in the top three meals I have ever had. The service was exceptional and the food  was incredible. My friend had short ribs and I had the filet.  The calamari appetizer was the best we have ever had. The beet salad was quite unique. I will definitely be returning here. Absolutely superb in every way!

DjlSMGIeQNq3huXiBpFhUA.text: Came here for happy hour last Wed. so this review is for the bar only.  We got the 3 tapas for $15 deal.  The food was fantastic but very small portions so we did end up ordering chips with salsa and guacamole on top of it.  The tapas trio was served on a wrought iron "tree" which makes for a beautiful presentation.  But you can see from the pics that it really only feeds one person unless you are planning to have dinner afterwards.  All the food was delicious but at the end of the night we spent almost $60 for two and still left hungry.  Of course, that was really my fault since I am a sucker for those high-priced specialty cocktails. Those went down a little too easy at $12-$14 a pop. I highly recommend the one with grapefruit and basil.  It was truly amazing.  Very tasty and fresh but not too sweet.  I also tried the one made with gin and chambord which I did not like as much as I thought would but it was made by the other bartender and I think that had something to do with it.  Unfortunately, I didn't catch either of their names so I am no help there.  But when you go, look for a woman at the bar with the long, sandy blond pony tail 'cause she rocks!  I probably should have just stuck to beer like my husband since those were only $4. Which is not bad considering they had a great selection, though unfortunately everything was bottled, no taps.  They had the usual higher end stuff like Stella, Guinness, and New Belgium. Plus some awesome local beers like Four Peaks (Kiltlifter and 8th St ale), San Tan (Epicenter and hefeweizen) and Nimbus (ipa).  Of course the setting was lovely since the bar is adjacent to Lon's and connected to their famous patio.  I just love the decor here.  Upscale rustic southwest, beautifully done.  It was too hot to sit outside but we did stroll around the grounds of the Hermosa Inn a bit and everything looked gorgeous.  We will definitely be back for dinner the next time we have a special occasion to celebrate.

photos.caption: Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Tapas tree-o
Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Patio

Yzl_WYJVTmoxmCgRyBK9fw.text: I've been here several times over the years on my various trips to Phoenix and never been disappointed. I recently spent a night at the Hermosa Inn where Lon's is located, so I actually ate three meals here and found the quality high again. The dining room is in what used to be cowboy artist Lon Megargee's house, so seating is in a couple of different rooms. There's also a patio dining area out front with a beautiful fountain, but it's typically not open in the summer and that's always when I come, so I've never been able to try that.   Service is always great, with lots of folks who have been working here for a long time. The menu has about 8 selections each for appetizer and main course. At dinner, I had the Arizona salad, which was greens with bleu cheese, pecans, mixed berries and a berry vinaigrette. Nice. My main course was one of the best things I've had lately--a roasted halibut with a mushroom broth, crispy snow peas for textural contrast, and a picked English cucumber salad to balance the salt of the fish. It was truly sensational. I'm not really that big on dessert (carbs are my weakness), but I tried their housemade sorbets, which included raspberry and blackberry-apple. They came with white-and-milk-chocolate straws. Very nice. The wine list surpasses extensive and borders on the ridiculous, but I found it to be very reasonably priced. There are over a dozen bottles in the $35-$40 range, then of course they go way up from there.   My only complaint would be that I've noticed over the years there is a lack of unusual dishes. They have creative and well-executed preparations of the standard fish, chicken, meat stuff, but I'd love to see some more adventurous game and fowl selections. I'd be very interested to see what the chef could do with things like bison, quail, elk, boar, etc. The menu changes frequently, but I have noticed that there seems to be a standard rotation of base ingredients.

U6dPbipCX4mvuEBh7Xt5IQ.text: Food and ambiance was fantastic.  Kenny was the best server, he was extremely knowledgable about the food and wine and the history of the resort/restaurant.  A total asset to have working for you. Of course you must sit on the patio and have Kenny as your server.  Just saying.......

fKsISEFsNk3gej-rHagDtA.text: I really enjoyed dinner here. There is a great outdoor patio, nice views, and an open fire and band.   The food was inventive and good. The duck breast was excellent.

iH-UICXqjiVSgXKSyamc-A.text: Called Monday and asked for a dinner reservation for the patio for Friday evening.  Disappointed when they claimed they could not guarantee us a table on the patio--they did not state that all patio tables were currently reserved.  Went elsewhere.

Gz-7Rp7kYXq40VekRko3EQ.text: Gorgeous property and the food was great. The reason for the 3 stars is service! It is Restaurant Week - our waiter - Joshua - told us to not focus on the special menu but to review the whole menu! Hello - the whole point of restaurant week is to take advantage of the special menu!! Once we ordered off the special menu his whole attitude changed - it was almost like we were not worthy of being in such a nice restaurant!! Plus I dared to order wine by the glass and my dining companion ordered the wine "on tap" - gasp!! It is too bad that what was supposed to be a fun girls night out was tainted by the waiters attitude!!

PUgN6lEyPfqm61UdtndWrA.text: On a crisp fall evening in Phoenix (which means 60 degrees) you can smell the wood fires burning on the expansive patio as the valet takes your keys.  This was a dinner for 4 and a birthday celebration for a 12 year old. Right away, the staff made our birthday guest feel special with her preference of seating (table 4- indoors with sunset views) and a birthday card from the restaurant. Our server, I think her name was Dolores, spoke with a French accent, which made the birthday experience even fatter for a 12 year old girl who had never climbed past Olive Garden fancy up til tonight. Dolores(?) answered all the questions the 2 younger guests had, such as what's Jidori mean? What is foie gras? And is pork belly really just bacon?  We started off the meal with the complimentary bread basket (chile corn bread, and the most awesome ancho flatbread) and some calamari. Calamari is supposed to be tender and not rubbery and this was perfectly cooked.  The menu changes seasonally at Lon's and we all decided that we were going to go for something hearty, so it was sea bass, pork duo and the Jidori chicken. Our server said the chicken was a half-bird, so two of us split that entree (which the staff accomplished at our table without a sidewards glance) and because the goat cheese mac n cheese is a requirement here, we ordered a side of that.   With 2 glasses of wine, an appetizer and 3 entrees, I spent $165 including the tip.  The patrons at Lon's are mostly an older crowd, but it's a classy place with really delicious food and great service and a rustic atmosphere. Perfect spot for a special occasion in Paradise Valley.

ib037cO9ymxlvWHdEXmaJA.text: Thank you Bill for inviting us back...Today was the Lon's I remember!!! The food was great...the service was great...John(the manager was charming and delightful)..the mango creme brulee was one of the BEST desserts I have ever tasted(don't miss it)...everything was pure PEFECTION. Obviously this restaurant seriously CARES about it's clientele. The most beautiful atmosphere  in Phoenix.  Lon's is back amongst my top 10 restaurant picks!

ConT47OHvUn1LdRAh9518Q.text: OMG!!! This place is a hidden gem... the atmosphere is superb, the food is to die for & the service is 5 star. I loved loved loved this place... it almost felt magical!!

Tz-CtwYfIu3KXqloEXb6jg.text: A beautiful setting for sure but word of caution, check your bill for phony pricing. My entree was priced at $38 on the menu but I was charged $41 for the same entree on the bill. Buyers Beware!!

wazo96mdZqsAoAggKAgvhw.text: 5-stars all the way.  No "if, and's, or butt's".  The patio itself is a work of art with fire pits, and warming stands for the winter months.  Inside feels like a converted house with different rooms and eclectic decor.  Even some of the employees are eclectic.  At first I thought the bartender was wearing a cowboy costume until I realized it's March.  We had a large group, were sat in a semi-private room and we were LOUD.  Apparently nobody complained.  Which is a miracle.  Prices are high but this place deserves what they charge.  Servers were all over us and the wine steward did an absolutely spectacular job and even helped point me towards the meal I wanted.... 10 oz. Strip, cooked to perfection with choice of two sides.  Parmesan Cheese fries were over the top delicious!  Everything was just outstanding.  Don't hesitate.  GO!!

kGw2mFS3O14FbQLsb09J-Q.text: My wife and I visited Lon's for Valentines Dinner.  I had been there before (and loved it), but I wanted her to experience the Lon's touch.    In my opinion, Lon's probably has one of the best ambiance in the business (especially at night).  It's all valet parking (don't forget cash).  The dress is resort casual (i wore jeans and a button up dress shirt).  As you walk up the patio is lit up by cool lighting, raging chimineas, and cool jazz being played by the live band.    We arrived a little early and were persuaded by one of the managers to grab a few drinks from the bar (the mojitos were great - the mint is freshly picked from their garden and when mixed it is strained so you don't suck up a mint leaf in your straw)   and join him on a tour of the place.  Every room at this restaurant is unique and different.  The wine cellar downstairs is like nothing I've ever seen.  Hundreds of selections of wines, amazing stone ceiling/floors/walls etc..  The place actually cures it's own ham in a small room downstairs next to the cellar.    After the tour we were seated and our Waiter for the evening was Ben.  He was a True delight.  He was a hip younger guy that was very professional and had a great sense of humor.  He was very helpful in tailoring the menu to our preferences.  I ordered a fish plate with dungeness crab, salmon, shrimp, with a red wine sauce on a toasted piece of french bread.  Having lived in the NW for years, I can honestly say the fish/crab was extremely fresh and cooked to perfection.  My wife had the short ribs and they too were wonderful.  We both had the strawberry mousse as a dessert and they were great as well.  Very rich, but the small size made it a dessert I could conquer.  The 3 course meal was proportioned perfectly and there wasn't that urge to take a power nap before you tackled the drive home.    Great service, food quality, and ambiance definitely worth the $$$$.  We'll be back!

IzXNssJRqnKnkTSS4TYuTA.text: So serene... eat an entree like the Beef short ribs. Appetizers are small enough for only one person. You also need to take a few seniors with you to fit in the crowd... :)

5PUYIJAt-VA5kAdSyVkx2Q.text: My wife arranged a surprise birthday lunch for her sister here. It went off incredibly well. The staff participated in making the surprise work. Thanks, Mike!  After the "surprise", we had a lovely lunch at a quiet indoor table. Appetizers and entrees were uniformly delicious.   Service was prompt, friendly and gracious. Thanks, Kevin!  After lunch, a surprise birthday dessert was served outside.  Everyone we saw seemed to be enjoying the themselves.  Overall it was a wonderful surprise, a wonderful meal and a very pleasant afternoon.

6zLgqFzGS4dPRUq4V9_8RQ.text: Dinner at Lons is always a treat.  A dreamy patio garden awaits those who reserve to be seated on the patio before 6:30PM.  The music was lovely sounded like Louisiana soul singer . A premium restaurant.  Lovely service and delicious food. My beet salad ...great. Salmon done perfectly.   Asked for it done  less than medium.  Bread was crunchy and delicious with herbed butter.  LONS IS EXPENSIVE..............But, worth it for your special date

pPO1LSV4phzAwtXxA1uZ9w.text: Excellent place for business or pleasure. They have wonderful indoor and outdoor seating. Staff is very helpful in guiding you through menu. Food was also good. I went with a group of friends and we each ordered something different. Food was excellent with a variety of options to choose from.  Overall it was a great first visit and I plan to visit again soon.  Well done Lon's!!

nondZxmloVbzqzvZbyphKQ.text: The best thing about Lon's was the atmosphere and Andrew, the host. Andrew gave us a mini-tour of the house and pointed us to the various sculptures around the stunning grounds. The second best thing was sitting on the patio under the stars, listening to the cowboy music. The food was good, not great, with the salads being the best part. It's a little heavy on the sauces. Service was medium-attentive; the bus boys were great. The bread basket was also really good.

p6yenz2JW4mteFaXgesyQQ.text: A classic in Phoenix - great decor; excellent food with service to match.  A perfect spot to take visitors from back east - it will give them a True taste of the west.

3BYUIWmY1Gj4nrAoqNDSVA.text: Amazing food, wine, happy hour, service, atmosphere, etc. Can't say enough about our experiences.  We love this place!  Uniquely cool!!  The hotel is one-of-a-kind!!

Ky9T5wumLuLR_Hs4dKaoGg.text: This is old Arizona at its best.  Not only is the restaurant just beautifully appointed, the history is amazing, the food is delicious and the staff first rate.  My favorite thing to do is eat outside on the patio, when the weather is good for that...but the inside is lovely as well.. Upscale, yet you see people in shorts and jeans as well...so it is not a stuffy place at all.  The food is served beautifully and there is a good variety.  I would like to see more vegetarian items, but that is my only complaint.  You will never be disappointed here.  I have attended cooking classes here, as well as a wedding and the property is just lovely, the flowers are beautiful and the rooms on the grounds are delightfully appointed as well.

xuEpHMGgD6NjA9Mnzc8HXQ.text: I've come by here for happy hour twice and have been impressed each time! We've had the same server who is the nicest gal and always on top of her game! although I have yet to come for dinner or brunch, the happy hour has a great menu to choose from and you're able to share with friends. Cheeseboard and a carafe of wine for $28, you can't beat that. The outdoor seating during the nice weather season is a must. Quiet, outdoor area with fire places. Inside they have a bar area along with big sista seating. The atmosphere is very laid back and quiet, where you can enjoy the camelback mountains while drinking a great wine!

photos.caption: Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States

w3R3YtDRYW4pJrE4njxBMw.text: Last evening three of us dined at Lon's, in the Hermosa Inn. We were returning guests. I have had wonderful lunches here, however, this was my first time for dinner  We were first greeted by Amy, a lovely and very friendly, hostess. She showed us to a great table. Now, it was a beautiful night and after 7 o'clock we were able to eat on the patio. The ambience couldn't have been more stunning with the candle light, twinkling stars and listening to Frank Sinatra in the background. No loud music here......it's peaceful, and one could actually hear conversation.  We all chose the 3 course dinner from Lon's tasting menu. We each had different appetizers which were very inventive and so delicious. Two of us had the halibut and 1 had  the pork shank. We chose two sides; parmesan truffled fries, with a dipping sauce that i could eat with every thing, ( I could get addicted to these, they were soooo delicious) and perfectly cooked broccolini. The halibut was moist and also perfectly cooked.  My friend loved the pork Shan as well.   We finished with peaches in a puffed pastry with vanilla creme fraiche, YUM! Canteen was our wonderful, attentive and very knowledgeable server.  A delightful evening was had and we plan to return soon.

D64a7grXSsW2P7hJi_oRXQ.text: Great place.  We stayed at the Hermosa Inn, and dinner and breakfast at Lon's were included as part of our package.  We were warmly greeted by the gentleman who was the host upon entering.  Dinner was fantastic - the strip steak was perfectly cooked and flavorful.  Started with the tortilla soup and finished with the panna cotta.  But our favorite part of the meal was the side of truffle fries - wow!  Thought it was great that they had local beer options from McFate Brewing on tap - rare to find them on tap around the valley outside of the brewery.  Our server was very pleasant and helpful, and my wife got a birthday card from the staff since it was her birthday.   We returned for breakfast the next day.  Breakfast menu was considerably smaller and a lot less options, but the food was really good.  I had the ham & cheese omelette, which was great.  Large portion of toast accompanied my omelette, and the crispy potatoes that came with the omelette were really good.    Overall a really great experience - wouldn't hesitate to return for an upscale meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. lovely outdoor eating area

zG3qojl9-3siPaPgvNbZRg.text: Our Valentine's Day meal was beautiful. It was our first time at Lon's and we absolutely loved it! The "last drop" cocktail was a great spin on an old fashioned and my raspberry lemon drop was to die for!!  Our server, Brandon, was awesome. He recommended great options on the menu and was very nice.  The person who really impressed me was Tracy, who would occasionally come fill our waters and grab our empty plates off the table. For such small gestures, he was so kind and respectful, and truly upheld the values that a restaurant like this should have. He was absolutely wonderful! I didn't have a chance to talk to the manager to tell him how great he was, so I hope he reads this or sees it once it's posted. Thank you Lon's for making our Valentine's Day so special!

GkyGCluemOBs-XfocpP4Qw.text: Dinner on the patio at Lon's is a highlight to any week.  Beautiful weather, lovely location, delicious food and super service.  One of my favorite dinner spots in Phoenix.

di4mcwIpKrLa8meDHMRhFw.text: The food was great. The reason I'm knocking a star off is because our waitress wasn't the nicest. The man helping her out was fantastic though, Manny was so kind and welcoming. He really made the place feel warm especially after how rude and irritated our waitress seemed. The host was very nice too. I got Mary's chicken which was fantastic. Bummer about our waitress because we walked away scratching our heads wondering if we were rude, but we weren't! We were so nice even when she forgot my drink order.

CQsIpg1II_ab4wrY4KfFQQ.text: This is one of my favorites always good.  I usually rate based on food, service and environment and to get a 5 star review you must be amazing.    Enjoy.

BsFvxeoGd93Pa0qyJl91dA.text: This place is pretty high class. Nothing wrong with that, I'm just used to divey type places. Had to attend a business dinner here last night and it's a really nice place. The food descriptions definitely caught me off guard as I didn't know what lost any of it meant! Lol I saw chicken and ordered what I thought I knew. Normally when I see chicken, I don't think of anymore than chicken off of the grill. But this meat was super tender and juicy however it was prepared! Everything was just really really good. If you like Brussel sprouts and want to try a different way of them being prepared then order a side of them for the table. They're deconstructed like and have an amazingly unique taste to them! I'm not used to the exceptional type of service offered here but it was a treat. The desserts are so good too. If you love chocolate and caramel and toffee then order the candy bar. It's literally a different taste in every bite. All in all this is definitely a place to try if you are in paradise valley and are looking to basically be pampered.

4Y9uT09F8LQF81F5F797DQ.text: Love love LOVE. The ambiance is perfection. Outside, the fire places! It's so quiet and secluded. My husband and I took his parents there and it's wonderful. The service was cam, detailed and we never felt rushed or ignored. The food- adore. Definitely one of the best meals I have ever had. I ordered the short ribs. The dessert is not too sweet and a nice small tasting almost. We just loved it.

_d20AC3y33XbzbxqyNwANQ.text: I took my team here for a work celebration and as a thanks for everything they have done for the year.  The ambiance was perfect, although the droppings from the trees onto the table and into our drinks was not really desirable. The space heaters kept it warm in the February air and the lighting at night was really lovely.  They made the perfect tequila gimlet for me, and my guests loved their drinks.  I would try the mule on tap; that was a table favorite.   Appetizers were delish.  We had the fritto misto, the beet salad, and the peppers.  They were all eaten!  For sides, the truffle fries and Brussels sprouts are a must do.  For 8 of us, we pretty much tried everything on the menu. They made me a gluten free meal that was amazing (short ribs).  Absolutely no complaints.  We also ordered a few desserts and passed around the table.  I would definitely do the smores bar.  Delish!  Excellent service as well.  Can't wait to come back, it was an awesome experience!

1JAm3fWJK49Is71u-zoTyw.text: Came here for Sunday brunch and the VIBES WERE SPOT ON. Everyone was relaxed, taking their sweet time and definitely enjoying and living in the moment. We were probably the youngest table there and all I could think about was OKAY I'M COMING TO EAT HERE AGAIN WHEN I'M RETIRED AND HAVE A LOT MORE TIME (if not earlier).   We took a walk around the Inn and it was fabulous - flowers everywhere and you can tell that folks put time and care into maintaining it (well duh, since a night is like $350+). This place is just too cute - I encourage everyone to spend time walking around inside and out!  On to the food!! We ordered the fluffy lemon pancakes and eggs benedict standard style - didn't want to stuff ourselves since we were going hiking. Portions looked small when it came out but it was surprisingly filling. Pancakes were souffle style - light, fluffy, with a cake-like texture.. yum. Eggs benedict was a nice salty balance to complement the pancakes.. delicious as well. Our waiter was very friendly and took good care of us - A+ there.  4 stars since I didn't get to try everything I'd like to (but definitely loved everything I DID get to try) and didn't order any drinks this time around. Will be coming back though!

KK6cwVeliBO31XUQX8485A.text: Lon's is an old school Arizona gem - hard to beat the setting and ambiance here.  We were a party of 5 enjoying brunch in their wonderful  outdoor space.  It is just plain gorgeous- flowers all around and mountains in the backdrop.   Every dish was well executed and enjoyed- the short rib hash a standout.  Slight marks off for the several cocktails which were just "meh"; even though the bar menu was appealing.  When I return I'll stick to beer, wine and champagne.  Service was great as well- we will be back here soon.

zy2sF0hfDJ346VB2OaROMQ.text: Went to Lon's for dinner tonight. They have valet parking. The place is really nice. Great host. Got table with no wait. Appetizers were great. Ordered lobster tempura, shitsto peppers. Had steak for dinner. Great food. Service is unbeatable.

AouWlyreNiENXATd5fPQ-w.text: Absolutely Five star brunch! The service is amazing ! The chef puts a nice twist of southwestern style with traditional brunch dishes. Great size dining room and outdoor patio . The staff was very attentive. The food was amazing. Valet service was available. After brunch we walked around the lovely property.

photos.caption: Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States
Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States
Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States

5JMyObkARzujOHRqKFJs3A.text: We always enjoyed this place. It's classic & the most lovely patio settings (ambience) we found. Always coming back here for the patio dining (out door seats - ah..Fresh Air!) & good food. Good selections of wines & Champagne and Cocktails. Cheers !

photos.caption: Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States
Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States
Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States

5BXaENIhNw2CIl1mWNjyvw.text: I went with a dear friend for my birthday lunch in December.  It was chilly at 11:30 am so we sat by the fireplace inside.  Our waiter was too attentive.  The appetizer of crabcakes was average.  Our main course took 45 minutes or so to come out after we finished the appetizer.    I could have had a better pulled pork at any chain restaurant.  The bun was terrible.  His salmon was cold and dry.  Took forever to get our check.   It was crowded on the patio when we left at 1:30 pm - much longer lunch than I desired. Were we forgotten?

sejfdWB02APxi18TRuoYlg.text: Went here with some friends. It was a perfect place to go for lunch during our tour for the Home and Garden show. The outdoor patio was beautiful with all the beautiful flowers! The wagu beef burger was excellent and huge. Everyone enjoyed their food.  Cocktails and service is good too.

qaU5QVVNnU9NCzsDmnXK7w.text: We had an excellent Anniversary dinner here tonight. We're from Nor Cal but our daughter and son-in-law live in Scottsdale.  They highly recommended Lon's and we agree:   Outstanding all-around evening.   Food, decor, setting and ambiance were perfect.    We'll be back as we make many trips each year to Scottsdale.

HWAqIZc7qcZSP2OtyfNWfA.text: Once again a beautiful sunset dinner in the garden. Menu continues to be exceptional, something for everyone. Wine list extensive, glasses attended regularly. This time I had the Hermosa salad, yummy, and the scallop appetizer, small but delicious. My husband's Filet was tender, cooked to perfection, not overdone with sauce. Tortilla soup was a little spicy. Th outdoor setting continues to be my favorite.  Maybe it's time to try a staycation soon!

0NaAjhV1JLXBoT9CL1R7gw.text: Spent the last morning of our trip to Phoenix having brunch at Lon's.    First off it is a beautiful outdoor garden setting.     We ordered the "monkey bread" to start.   So yummy, sweet and delicious, really did want to lick the bowl but this place is just a little too classy for that.  The kitchen did a wonderful job in tailoring the entree's to our food allergies so big thumbs up for that.  The breakfast pizza was wonderful but on the smaller side and the goat cheese was applied unevenly resulting in 2 slices with a large amount and 3 with almost none.    Taking a few extra seconds to even it out would have been a big help.  The breakfast hash was good not great but I'm not really a fan of short ribs so maybe that's a we ordered wrong not really the fault of the kitchen.     We did look at the meals served around us and all were really well presented and looked fantastic.     If your looking for a great place to "check out" of the city and relax for a wonderful brunch experience.  Lon's is your place

wi34YcNOS9clKlrbezRwkQ.text: We took our out of town guests there for Sunday brunch. The food was a major disappointment. My eggs benedict were over-cooked and served with just a swipe of hollandaise, thus VERY dry and tasteless. The others ordered the short rib hash, also over-cooked and dry.  We had to ask repeatedly for our coffee cups to be refilled. C'mon, this is brunch--at least leave us a carafe if you can't keep up! Service was dismal, almost as if they hadn't expected guests. You could get a much tastier meal at Ihop for a fraction of the price. That aside, it's a lovely  setting and the guitarist playing in the garden was a delightful touch.

M1OaxXTlFhgjJfWPMq4NDw.text: This is a beautiful place! Love the outdoor seatings. The panna cotta dessert was to die for. Wish they have a little more options on their lunch menu.

2_Fjz3-v7OuGOCbpFa3N1Q.text: My wife and I went to Lon's at The Hermosa during restaurant week and were both very pleased with our meals, the service, and overall ambiance.  While there was a small glitch in the reservation time that was made with open-table and what the restaurant wrote down, they were able to seat us quickly and no delay was experienced.    My wife went with the Restaurant Week menu and the portions were all big enough to leave feeling full.  I went with the 10 oz fillet and steamed vegetables and was very impressed with the quality of the meat.  We will definitely come back to Lon's at The Hermosa and will be recommending it to family and friends.

xVa3UfrI9bHhhF26GlJlXA.text: Our bartender was very nice. Plus he made a mean prickly pear margarita. They had awards plastered on the walls at the bar about their "award winning" cocktails.   Complimentary valet-plus.  Live entertainment, and beautiful outdoor seating.  I ordered tomatoe and mozarella salad (which personally could have had some more greenery), and the salmon for the main course.  The asparagus and salmon was cooked to perfection a nice blend of flavors.  Definitely not a place to dine on a budget, but it is well worth the money.

cL4F34RJh47mqPWUJv6M9g.text: I've never actually eaten here so I'm not sure how amazing the food is and I will not be finding out any time soon.   Here is my experience...I walked into the restaurant for dinner and there was no one in sight. The maitre dee asked my name for a reservation and i stated I was a walk in. He said...let me see what I have but you may be sitting in a room by yourself. He proceeded to say, "let me see to these guests and then I'll try to seat you!"  An older couple was still outside walking up that he felt where a priority over finding me and my guest a table. As I was standing in the doorway completely embarrassed in front if my guest and thinking about how demeaning the person was I walked out and decided not to eat here.   This place may have amazing food and amazing cocktails but I was not able to get past the service.  I will not be going back nor would I ever recommend someone subjecting themselves to that kind of treatment.

gRFFVoUCF3Stqa6anFp-9A.text: We went for restaurant week. The choices  were weak for what was offered. Very expensive!!! The ambiance of the patio was wonderful. Our service not very good which was disappointing considering we're drive quite a ways to try this restaurant.

0rP8NYgpqAfFg4f4KgQi-g.text: We were so excited to try this place out. We had family in town and wanted to show them a nice time. The place wasn't busy at all, we decided to sit inside since it was really hot outside. Our server had 3 tables max. It took him forever to come by and occasionally check on us. The monkey bread was delicious but we ordered the Eggs Benedict, which were fine. But the side of potatoes were the bottom of the barrel, 3 day old sterile, hard potatoes. Not what I would imagine from a nice place like that. Also, I wasn't the only one with a child in diapers, I saw at least 2 other families with little ones. They didn't have a place to properly change her. I must say they were very accommodating but I'd recommend they invest in a changing station, I'm sure they get asked a lot. I would go back for a cocktail on a cooler evening the outside ambiance is very lovely.

Yr2ZNQZxojwe3QuGsiOL_A.text: Definitely a place for a quiet dinner. A nice break from the typical loud Scottsdale Steakhouse. From the appetizers, to the salads, to the entrees each dish is prepared with passion. A little expensive but worth every penny.

JY8-A05zrQNKueFZ9hozXg.text: Went during Arizona Restaurant Week and everything was fabulous.

sAk28OYCvAAg5DHl-f3Vsw.text: Had the 2nd worst meal ever here, behind only Vincent's on Camelback (feel free to see my review of that place)  I wish I would have remembered the old chef left at the start of august  It started pretty poorly, then they started cooking which made things even worse  Walking in there was on one to greet us, we had to track down the hostess (not a big deal but a minor quibble, with the pricing they have that is something that should never happen)  They ran out of the tasting menu at 8PM on a Saturday on the holiday weekend, as well as they running out of pasta - we were informed after being seated, ordering drinks and a bottle of wine, and deciding on the tasting menu - so at least 15-20 minutes passed since sitting down with zero mention of them being out of anything, which should have been mentioned when we were presented with the menu's   All of the fish dishes (ciappino and halibut) were overcooked and dry, as were the Short Ribs (which is hard to do)  My tenderloin came out rare vs med rare (which is fine for me) but was overly salty to the point it was about inedible, and also had a piece of bacon on top of it - why would you ruin a good piece of meat with strip of bacon on top - made no sense, sent it back  The cocktails there were very poor, French 75 I think only looked at the gin bottle instead actually having any poured in and the whiskey smash which was on their "special" menu was terrible - if Travis is a good bartender or runs a good bar program this was certainly not evident, and they have a Mai Tai listed on the menu but don't even have orgeat listed as an ingredient so that was enough to steer me off of that one, but I am sure it would have been very orangey and come in a Collins glass with a slice of orange  The only bright spot which was small (literally undersized) was the foie gras, which was done very well and seared, with a light jam underneath the toast, and some peanut butter-ish spread on the side with some huckleberries - however the portion was about the size of a tasting menu portion not an appetizer portion - perhaps they were running out of foie gras as well, but I don't expect 3 bites out of a $16 app  Poor all the way around - Do not waste your money here

n1rwvCyiKbU9o0yMe5mhmg.text: What a disappointment!   We have been here several times and this was the last. We met out of town friends for lunch.  Nothing I saw on website said that it was only brunch on Saturday afternoon.  Very limited menu!!   My chicken strawberry salad was terrible.  Chicken meant little pieces of dark meat.  Other ingredients were shredded.  It was bad. We shared desserts at the table and the cowboy dessert needed a chainsaw to cut and they did not give us a knife!!   Our water glasses were left empty.  Obviously it was embarrassing and disappointing. It is time to judge by food and service and not pretty flowers.

VHDrHK925Ew5uTjVIpXlAA.text: Sushi grade Ahi served on a 500 degree block of Himalayan sea salt. A lone short rib, cubed, perched atop a bed of braised root vegetables. So majestic looking, it reminded me of a sentinel on lookout. A hangar steak (flank) cooked to perfection.  All three shared two common themes: Both the presentation and sodium levels were immeasurable.  I love Lon's. I want to show them off to my friends from out of town.  I love their wine cellar...it's dungeon-esque type features. I want to eat there on special occasions because I know I won't be disappointed. But this trip had me rethinking everything I know about Lon's and that's saying something since I've been going there for many years now.  The gravy on the hangar steak was inedible it was so salty. My girls secretly wiped it all away so as not to create a stir with our server, knowing I would send it all back and give him a couple of what-fers in the process. My short rib was braised perfectly, however, it was dry and lean. Not what I was hoping for. And the pre-dinner bread basket had the most delicious looking chips, also inedible due to the extreme salt content.  Stay out of the bar. I ordered a Crown Royal Manhattan. I was informed they don't serve Crown Royal, but some bullshit well whiskey called Buffalo Trace. Seriously, who doesn't serve Crown? I expected Lon's to serve Crown Black for Christ's sakes. My wife ordered a Mai Tai. It was undrinkable.  Lon's, here's some advice from the cheap seats. Stop believing your own press clippings and take a long hard look in the mirror.  At the very least, hire an executive chef whose cravings for salt doesn't rival a 14th century sailor sporting a goiter the size of a basketball.

MEidIfXDBVb88utdrh45gw.text: Oh My!  Horrible!  Chewy fish and cold chips, indiscernible chicken in the salad,  another salad with funky tasting salad dressing, and a pita full of mush. Four of us dinning and not one enjoyed the meal!  The food took forever, the bread came after our entrees and the service was non existent. What happened Lon's at the Hermosa Inn???  The one star is earned only for the charm of this used-to-be wonderful destination for lunch, dinner and drinks!  So disappointing!!!! It was horrible!

bNTj6LJwrzuSOegmXa02-A.text: Great spot tucked away in the back roads of Paradise Valley. Very friendly greetings when we walked in. We had reservations so we were offered the choice of inside or outside. We were forewarned that people had complained of mosquitoes outside so we immediately decided on inside seating. My sister and I are both mosquito magnets. The service was good yet we noticed how a server for another table gave a much more thorough explanation of the menu selections. Now back to what should have been the end of the mosquito issue. We were seated inside but found that there were mosquitos a plenty hovering around our table. We decided we'd keep an eye on them to help each other not get bitten. Those guys are sneaky though. Before we finished our wonderful meal (me the lamb duo, my sister the chicken), we both had been bitten 3 times. One of my sister's bites was on the bridge of her nose. One of my bites was on the ankle THROUGH MY THICK SOCK. They were ferocious. It kinda ruined the dining experience. Our waiter brought a citronella candle but the damage was already done. We wanted out of there before we sustained another bite. We mentioned it to the manager. He apologized. I felt the sincerity...I think???

a0fBCcABeNJdBh4WrOHnXA.text: Fantastic food and awesome service!!! Ask to sit in Richard's section aka Joe!!!! I highly recommend the ahi tuna. One of the best nights. Thanks to the staff!!

LsILO2WCItQ0KicGAe12Ug.text: Ambiance. Service. Food. Wine. Everything about the evening was absolutely tremendous. The server was engaging and on top of everything, management went out of there way to check on us and make sure our evening was complete. We were so happy, we bought a gift certificate for family friends to use during a future visit.

fwehuOk6nvbYUvBDAfzMVw.text: A friend recommended Lon's, and I am thankful that she did. I went there for brunch, and thought the food and atmosphere were terrific. The price was also very fair for a meal of that quality. The service was also quite good.

FO4dbNxL6Jtd5JN47QUxTA.text: This restaurant is absolutely incredible.  We went recently for my grandmother's 95th birthday.  Usually, we go to Elements when we visit Arizona, but they have a new 48 hour cancellation policy that doesn't work great if you have diners over 90 years old (never know if someone may not feel up to a big dinner), so we decided to try somewhere new.  I am so glad that we did!  The food was unbelievable.  We started with the calamari (surprisingly light and not at all greasy) and the Hermosa Salad, which had no right to be as delicious as it was.  All of our entrees were also fabulous, though, to me, the standout was the pork chop.  I am a big pork lover and I have never had a better pork chop.  Ever.  The lamb was also delicious and the sauces were incredible.  The filet was also great, just wish that there was more gnocchi (I'm crazy about gnocchi and it's often not done as well as it is here).  For sides, we got the truffle mac and the corn, both of which were amazing.  I love the truffle mac, most times the truffle is kind of overpowering, but the flavor was great and the pasta was really really good.  A lot of times it just feels like places smother boxed pasta with cheese, but this pasta could have been homemade it had such great texture.  We got the sticky toffee pudding for dessert which, like the rest of the meal, was unreal.    The thing that made our family decide that we'd choose Lon's over anywhere else moving forward, though, was the incredible incredible service.  My family loves to eat out and we've had the opportunity to go to a lot of great places, but we all agreed that we'd never had better service.  It was, frankly, perfect.  Our server, Richard, was kind, helpful, and seemed to read our minds with what we might like and when we might have a question.  Every random request was met with incredible graciousness.  My grandma said afterwards that she felt so special.  Highly, highly recommend!  Only things to keep in mind: the menu on OpenTable isn't current, in their less busy season (aka middle of summer), the menu is a little smaller.  Also, the Hermosa is going through construction, so the view isn't quite as nice as it could be near the side.

mLhBpuG347qkfrlewtu3Bw.text: Although the price points tip toward the higher end, consider Lon's an investment in your palate!! From the best patio setup I've encountered in Phoenix to exquisite food and gracious service, a date night at Lon's is delicious happiness! Their mac and cheese perfectly warms my soul on a chilly winter night, and their scrumptious carpaccio is light enough for toasty summer sunsets. Their wine list is essential for romantic gazing and toasting to felicity while listening to musicians croon and strum. They also have super accessible specials to make a truly happy, happy hour!

9hijvRVZoCRdSNQ1i6xE6A.text: Excellent deal on chef tasting menu for $49 and wine pairing additional $20.  Dungeness crab cucumber gazpacho, smooth and cool, perfect for the hot Phoenix weather.  Smoked pork short ribs, saw she smoke rings, tender and seasoned well.    Passion fruit style semifreddo, plated beautifully and a great light finisher with the mascot paired.

G79XflE0MCf_13E7APQF1g.text: Beautiful atmosphere when you eat outdoors.   Food is very good.   Unbelievably overpriced... so there is no value.

vxNR1Kh14XbO-vB5dOhd8A.text: Outstanding in every way. Great food, service, ambiance, and friendly wait staff. Beautiful garden setting with tons of flowers and desert plants, with mountains in the background.   Lobster Eggs Benedict...Absolutely delicious!

pNYmtKP2hBSeZJn_Qbnm-Q.text: Lon's always pleases. An historic treasure in the desert, Lon's at the Hermosa Inn is fine dining at its best. I treated my friend to a birthday lunch. I arrived early. This gave me a chance to enjoy the fine art decor, as I surveyed the restaurant. The summer is a down time for so many of the smaller properties in the Valley. Therefore, it is important that we get out and continue to support them. The Shrimp and Crab Salad was awesome, and the Ruben Sandwich was decadent! The server presented her with a lovely plated dessert. Happy Birthday was written in chocolate. The staff signed a lovely birthday card.  She was so surprised. These are the touches that make Lon's a special place.

jP8jg-c302lLCkqQFqLEOw.text: My new favorite in the 'hood. Such a stunning setting with lots of gorgeous landscaping and super service.  The bar is a yummy place to sip cocktails and people watch ...the restaurant is the piece de resistance, however. The food is sublime!  From the Tempura Lobster to the beautifully presented Ahi Tuna ...every morsel sends your mouth into a happy dance!

1zKlAc1F7AlTYvtyHEmaRw.text: Just the walk the walkway to the restaurant is romantic.  I like the dessert southwest ambience.    enjoyed dinner here during restaurant week with Crab stuffed squash blossoms, heirloom & goat cheese for appetizers.   Main course: Halibut and pork chops for the husband.  Dessert:    They offer a 10 page book of wines to choose to pair with your dinner.    Walking the grounds after dinner was so nice.   Enjoy a bottle of wine and dine at this romantic restuarant and stay for the night and relax in this beautiful and enchanting Inn.    We will definitely back for another delicious meal, this time we'll bring the whole family.

D4TR8XeUhXoZBTWqMf94cA.text: I enjoyed sitting on the patio. The weather was pleasant and there was a beautiful sunset. The food was fantastic. There was a bread board brought to the table. I particularly liked the mini cornbread. I had Bob's Squash Blossom with chorizo & cheddar stuffed, corn pudding, pickled peppers. This appetizer left me wanting more and the presentation was very artful. The main entree was Alaskan Halibut with snap peas and I'toi onion pesto and lemon vinaigrette. The Halibut was cooked just right and was moist and flavorful. I had a local dessert made with Schnepf's farms peaches, puff pastery, vanilla creme fraiche, honey gelato.  It was all very delicious.

elVrvaFrPaqP79tLfLqm4g.text: Everybody I was with thought it was truly five stars. (I was with like 10 people!)

YceVyUQfEof3YSpr1HKMIA.text: Sat at the bar the other night for happy hour and will definitely be going back!  The food and drinks were creative and delicious.  The bartenders and hostess were very friendly.  And the garden, patio, and decor were beautiful.  It's a no-brainer go-to place for us from here on out.

FLOpkfOdfbcqfk6AlGXGKg.text: **See note at the bottom for parking**  Finally made it to Lon's at The Hermosa to celebrate a special occasion, and it was such a great experience.  We don't usually sit outdoors at restaurants but the weather was just perfect and we went for it. It was lovely.  All the staff was very friendly and professional, and our server Scott was outstanding. He was very upbeat, awesome with drink refills, had great recommendations and, honestly, shared with us very clever remarks that made our evening fun and memorable. He made us feel super well taken care of.  The place itself is really nice, and the outdoor seating area was very beautiful and enjoyable.  Regarding parking, upon arrival it seems they only have valet parking (which I honestly do not like). We inquired about self parking and were told to enter the valet parking and drive past it. Towards the end of the lot there is a self parking section. Voila!

oHYlTXos8CgCIVT5D8Mwrg.text: We say outside-it was a little warm but beautiful! They close their outside dining in July and August and that makes sense. We had the summer menu which included a delicious tomato, peach. and feta salad with micro greens, halibut cooked to perfection, and a peach dessert with fresh ice cream. Service was great. This place is reliable AF. We will be back.

svEoP_t0VEjmqeokx1JwiQ.text: Love Lon's - great food, service and drinks! And the patio is perfect this time of the year for dinner. I had the short ribs which come with a goat cheese polenta cake and holy yummy it was on point. Don't forget the warm churro for dessert!

photos.caption: Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Short ribs were on point
Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. AMAZING warm churro dessert

j7gvg-RfUI_3VedibjJMFQ.text: My family has been going to Lon's for years for Christmas Eve dinners, and this year's dinner was just as delicious and memorable as the rest!   If you're looking for an upscale but classic "Old Arizona" style restaurant, it doesn't get better than this. The service is always spectacular with knowledgeable and friendly waiters, and you feel taken care of from the moment you step out of your car.   The food is always top-notch, and usually has some interesting, unique menu options you might not get elsewhere (think rattlesnake, ostrich, etc). This year I went with the pecan-grilled filet mignon and was not disappointed. We also were very curious what a Churro Tree was, but you'll have to see my picture to find out for yourself!  I feel like eating at Lon's is more of an experience than just a meal - it's also about the atmosphere, the music, the lights, the decor, the service ... just wonderful.

photos.caption: Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Just inside to the left by the warm fireplace.
Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Churro tree!

e6dqUi3GHOHUgtLeGFj_tw.text: It had been a year since we last visited.  The Hermosa Inn has that Boutique Hotel flair making you feel at home.  Yesterday we started  our day there with lunch in the patio. I had a Cobb salad, a perfect lunch considering we were going to have a very busy day and evening. Our small party ordered a myriad of other lunch items. All was excellent.  I would like to add that we were scheduled to have a catered lunch on site. We walked by it a few minutes prior to lunch time.  Our buffet was set up on long banquet tables topped with sandwiches. Fruits etc.  Unfortunately flies were attacking the food.  We opted not to eat our catered lunch for this reason.  The majority of our group didnt see what we saw.

050mJoLejOlMdwdKVI9XQw.text: One of our favorite places.  Great food, exceptional service, and beautiful southwest rustic decor. Great for dinner and events. A real treat in Phoenix.

x1S6XfHnSsep1LD0sOgLEQ.text: I love a nice, leisurely brunch, and this place was pretty solid.  - The pretzel starter was bigger than I expected- soft, warm, salty, just a hint of sweetness with spicy mustard and warm cheese for dipping.  - My shrimp and crab salad was delish- light, refreshing, generous portion of crab meat. - They have a few different bloody mary options- the chipotle version was ok, but the horseradish and yellow tomato even better. - Candy bar dessert was super rich. Dense caramel topped with a few nuts and covered with thick chocolate, sprinkled with salt. It really did taste like a candy bar, but one bite was enough for me. - Iced coffee was fine, but took forever to arrive and not worth $5.  Our server was friendly, but seemed to forget about things- like bringing a requested wine list or picking up or delivering the coffee orders, but honestly not a big deal since I'd prefer this over being rushed through brunch. Recommend, especially if the weather is nice enough to sit outside.

photos.caption: Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Fab seafood salad- sorry about the shadow.

4rYzy1kmr4i5ONHdnJ__hA.text: My wife, a couple of friends of ours and I had a great lunch. To be honest I can't remember what everybody had but it all tasted great and we passed around all the plates. The service was excellent and we sat outside in a perfect setting. We've been there a few times and we'll be back again.

efLm1wikNZWlteJlO0UV7Q.text: Just beautiful and peaceful encounters with good food . Fun for special occasions like birthday party.

EzU2zq8qUFQriE2km_MoBA.text: Lon's is a beautiful location, food is very good.. Setting, history, decor help to make up for glitches. We had one. Waited over an hour for our main course. For the money they charge,inexcusable. Waiter & all the staff were top notch. They did their best. This problem lies directly on the lap of top management.

xRo3xjtZtJFLia_RjK6ktA.text: Intimate and cozy beautiful the fireplace was inviting.  The rose was light and slightly sweet and the popcorn appetizer was delightful.  Stunningly landscaped and pretty groupings of cacti. A hidden gem.

X7iFALKOmFAWlo5MmktN7Q.text: I just expected more from a Paradise Valley establishment.  I have eaten at hundreds of restaurants, very few deserve four or five stars.   This place is not one of them.  The food was decent but lack the flair which truly great chefs give their dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Lon's At the Hermosa - Paradise Valley, AZ, United States. Just for the halibut

XOlugI25IIhihcDQqW2Tug.text: Ambiance for dinner on the patio is romantic,  surrounded by a beautiful fountain, chiminea and mini tree lights with camelback mountain in the horizon. Food was very good, service excellent.  A cowboy sings and yodels well, however he's a little obnoxious when talking to the audience and loud when mingling.
